Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, ok room”
Reviews.Author: RamblingRed
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at another Club Quarters (in Houston) and really enjoyed it and that's what led me to this one in Chicago. Many of the features I enjoyed like the lower price (just about $100/night), the free wireless, the professional service, and the beloved water bottles, are at this location. However, I wasn't thrilled with the room. My biggest issue was how stiflingly stuffy it was. I almost thought we had a smoking room by accident (*disclaimer*: we didn't follow up on this, as we didn't see any ashtrays and frankly we were too tired once we arrived to deal with it) but it actually seemed like general mustiness, possibly from the heater. The worse part was that the window wouldn't open even an inch so there was no way to get some fresh air in. Bummer. I couldn't wait to get out each day. Good inspiration to see the city, I suppose. The room itself seemed large and clean though I think it was getting a little worn out. The bed was pretty hard and we could tell it was two twins pushed together. There wasn't a view, just an ally, but the location in the heart of the city more than made up for that. That's why I would still probably recommend this hotel, as we could walk to the L, Millennium Park, the Art Institute, and tons of restaurants within minutes. The river and Magnificent Mile weren't too much of a walk either. At the price we paid, it nearly made up for everything. Maybe if they threw in a free breakfast we'd be even? (Do note that there are two Club Quarters in the city. This is the Central Loop location. We didn't realize this until our friends ended up at the other one wondering why we weren't meeting them in the lobby.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: Because of an unexpected family emergency, we were unable to actually stay the night. However, the staff and even the manager of the hotel went out of there way to make sure we were well taken care of and sent us off on our way safely. Even on a very busy day (St. Patty's day) check in was quick and efficient. The lobby was bright, clean and shiny...very welcoming. The location is amazing....near everything you would want to do in downtown Chicago. I cannot comment on the rooms since we didn't stay the night. But I cannot imagine that they would be bad...and if there were any complaints I am sure they would be taken care of immediately!

Reviews.Title: “bright and shiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hilary444
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights last week during a trip for work. I was a little worried before arriving because I booked the smallest room they have, one of those tiny economy rooms. But it and the hotel had nearly everything I needed. A couple minor deficiencies are at the end of this review. Everything in this hotel seemed really new and very up to date. The business center had free computer use. The rooms had free, fast wireless. The fitness center was actually pretty spacious and had four treadmills, some ellipticals and two stationary bikes, plus a few benches, some free weights, weight machines and nice mats for stretching. Everyone at the front desk was extremely nice, helpful and professional. I really felt like I got top-notch treatment. The room itself, while small, had plenty of room to walk around. It had a nice big TV, a small closet, a couple of drawers, a comfy chair and a full-sized desk. It also had a really small closet -- but it was plenty for one person for two nights. In the bathroom, there was no tub, just a shower stall, but it was relatively spacious and had a hand-held shower nozzle. Everything was clean, clean, clean. My only complaints, and they're very small ones, were that the bath towel I had was very rough. Not even a little bit soft. There is coffee in the room but NO BREAKFAST. Not even a danish. I room service for dinner -- a salad -- from the in-house restaurant. It was delicious, but beware that they add a 15 percent gratuity to the bill automatically, no matter how little you order. And it stops serving at 10 p.m., which is a little early for me. Otherwise, this was a great experience and I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Donald O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was accomodating, was booked into a smoking room, (didnt know they had them anymore) went to the desk and was given a non smoking room big difference, room had everythin we needed, comfortable beds, flat sreen tv, microwave/ refrigerator nice bathroom location was good near the mall and lots of restaurants, close to a good friend, liked the room and amenities, only letdown was breakfast, not much left when we went down there (busy weekend I guess otherwise good experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent no-frills value and location”
Reviews.Author: janababy
Reviews.Content: I stay at the CQ-Loop a couple times a month for business. It is always clean, the self service check in and check out is efficient and gotta love free bottled water. The only thing you have to watch for is an interior room that has no windows and only a skylight. Otherwise, you are super close to the Chicago Art Institute (stays open til 8 on Thursdays with free admission in the summer)/Michigan Ave. On site Elephant and Castle pub has the best fish and chips in town. Several restaurants deliver as well - Bella Bacino has THE BEST deep dish pizza in Chicago. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient downtown Chicago business travel location with all the basics”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient for business at the Willis Tower. Check in and checkout were speedy and efficient. Club room was small, but for just myself it was cozy. Dinner right next door at the Elephant and Castle highly recommended. Will definitely return for future business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly nice”
Reviews.Author: Oceansmith
Reviews.Content: Decided to try it because it was inexpensive and very close to where I needed to be for meetings. Very efficient rooms. Nice work space. Bed was only OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: coopmke
Reviews.Content: Stumbled upon this hotel while searching for somewhere to stay while in town for the Packers-Bears game. We actually used the travelocity secret hotel deals and got a great rate on this hotel... making it very worthwhile. We booked a room with two beds (NOTE: two twin beds) and it was myself and my boyfriend, along with another couple. Needless to say things were tight, but we were not in town to enjoy the hotel room. The room was on the smaller side, but if we could pull off having 4 of us and all of our luggage, I would hardly say that size was a major issue. This is especially true if you are travelling with 2 people to a room. Essentially the room was just a base camp, as we went shopping soon after we arrived and went out Saturday night, took the L back to sleep and woke up early to shower and prepare for the game, then checked out and headed to brunch/tailgate. If you are planning on spending a significant amount of time in your room, or are travelling with a group... this hotel may not be the best option. Check in was a breeze and everyone was very nice, from the valet to the desk attendants. We got a room right away and found it to be clean - having a mini fridge in the room was a nice touch and the bathroom was very clean as well. The hotel itself was quiet and the bottled water on each floor was a nice addition as well, especially Sunday morning after a late night out in Wrigleyville. The location of this hotel was convenient to many areas (Millennium Park, shopping, dining) of the city as well as for catching the red line, location is definitely a strong point. There was a spot to hold luggage after check-out, and it was very secure (someone at the door of the room at all times). Overall, it was a good experience and I would come back again if heading to Chicago under similar circumstances. Staff was friendly (even engaged in some good-hearted heckling when we came down in Packer gear) and although the rooms were small-ish, the price and location couldn't be beat! Perfect option for twentysomethings like us, looking to spend money on entertainment, shopping, drinks and dining rather than a swanky, overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “an economic option”
Reviews.Author: turistadeccs
Reviews.Content: very close to sears towers , like 4 blocks, it is very automatic hotel you do your own check in and check out in machines, AND IF YOU DO NOT FEEL ABLE, they will help you bring credit card, they will charge all the amount plus deposit once into those machines give free water in bottles, nice internet room in the basement

Reviews.Title: “Chicago weekend”
Reviews.Author: PattyGail45
Reviews.Content: the room was very small but didn't spend much time there other than sleeping. Very quite and clean. Friendly staff. WONDERFUL location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Low Frills Hotel and Smoky Smelling Room”
Reviews.Author: nicolas617
Reviews.Content: Not much going for this hotel but not bad enough to rate poor. Small rooms decorated in a sort of modern style. Bare bones amenities but free internet is a good perk. Free chilled water and bottles in the hallways is kind of nice. Bad news was my room had a bad under odor of smoke. The bare bones theme permeates the hotel from the tiny lobby and restaurant to the rooms. Very good location but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tgm_oslo
Reviews.Content: This hotel give you good value for money. Small room, but large enough for a yoga on the floor. Shower is OK, and clean. Bed is large and down blanket makes the night. Small but adequate fitness room also, and cold water on bottles at the elevator is nice. For work and sightseeing the location is good. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Basic”
Reviews.Author: 50mags
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went there just for 1 night on a Sat, the rate was $129.00. We took the train from Milwaukee and it was nice just to walk to the hotel. We did not have a reservation and the staff was very accomodating, they did have plenty of rooms they told us. We usually stay at The Comfort Suites on Michigan Ave but we thought that we would try something different and still stay in our price range. The rooms are VERY SMALL, if we had more than 1 bag we would've had to climb on the bed to get across the room. When I turned on the bathroom light in the middle of the night it lit up the whole room. The mattress was very hard and not at all the comfortable when I sat on the bed (because there is no other place to sit) I could feel the "rim" of the mattress poking my legs and it was sooo hard. Also, when the other hotel guests shut their door it is so loud, especially at bar time. My advice is that for an extra $10 or $20 dollars, go to a different hotel it was NOT worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: junebug768
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a wedding and stayed at the Club Quarters Central Loop. The room was clean and adequate for what we needed. King sized bed was comfortable. The bathroom sink area was a little small, but workable. We were on the 3rd floor and it was very quiet. Could hear nothing from out on the street. Had trouble finding something open for breakfast on Sunday morning, so we ended up at the Elephant and Castle attached to the hotel. It was ok, but overpriced. Hardly dealt with staff at all due to electronic check in and out, which was very easy. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “In the center of it all!”
Reviews.Author: Montaukbeachgoer
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the middle of The Loop. Located on Adams street a.k.a. The Historic Route 66! Yes it true. The room we stayed in was very clean, small with a queen sized bed, microwave, sink, coffee maker, tv, chair, desk and shower room. No bath. Not much of a view though. We had a fire escape outside of our windoe that was facing an alley way. the only window was tucked in a corner. There was a very European feel to the hotel with clean lines, leather chairs and very attentive staff. Check in was easy and security was good. You need a credit card type of pass key to roam around the hotel especially if you want to use the elevator. The sitting areas of the hotel were comfortable with a tv and an electric fireplace. Good value for the money. Shopping, sightseeing, and lots of good eating only minutes walking distance away. Really enjoyed the stay. Parking your car? Shell out $35.00 per day. Leave tha car home and use the trains. This rate was the better deal than others in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but somehow didn't feel clean.”
Reviews.Author: kkaseb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Club Quarters in several cities and they are all pretty predictable. They are geared for business travelers so you can get great rates on weekends. The rooms are fairly small, especially the bathrooms. I wanted to like this hotel more than I did. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. But I couldn't get rid of the feeling that I wasn't sure how clean it was although nothing was obviously dirty. I think it was because the bathroom was a little worn with discolored grout in the walk-in shower (plus you have to stand right on the drain). Also, they still use the dark patterned bed covers instead of the white ones. Lobby is quite nice and, although I didn't go myself, the attached restaurant was bustling.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: redhead8811
Reviews.Content: My sons and I joined my husband at Club Quarters for an overnight while he attended a conference and the hotel was pretty much what we expected. It was very clean but our room was a little shopworn. It could use a new coat of paint, especially in the bathroom and the a/c was problematic, we never did seem to cool off. But the location was great, we walked all over the neighborhood and the kids really enjoyed being in the city. The staff was very personable and went out of their way to answer questions and see to our needs. We loved the pub, Elephant & Castle that is adjacent to the hotel. I would definitely recommend Club Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Great business travel locale!”
Reviews.Author: SmokeyBlueTulle
Reviews.Content: Despite a mix-up in my reservation, which was resolved by extremely helpful staff, I settled into a very quiet, small room om the 8th floor. The free bottled water was refreshing and the tv cable, andwifi were terrific! I wish they had plastic bottle recycling for all the water bottles. The room was very clean. Nice place to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Surpirsed by houw much we like it”
Reviews.Author: gambone33
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared when I booked the hotel because the price was so low. I was very shock when I arrived. The hotel has everything you want. Great price, location,staff,etc. Does it have all the bells and whistle no but if your in Chicago just for the weekend the hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great price!”
Reviews.Author: Cowboyfan2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights mid-sept. Two blocks to the L where u can get to just about anywhere in city in 20 min for $2.25. Great for business & leisure. Restaurants all around. Bottled water refreshing way to start/end the day. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “If you're touring a town, Club Quarters is the way to go”
Reviews.Author: CoreyGlynn
Reviews.Content: My $0.02: If you're traveling somewhere to see the sights and are looking for a hotel that will just "do the job", this is great choice. The service is excellent, the hotels are centrally located (have stayed in NY and Chicago properties) and have just the right level of amenities to make your stay work: nice rooms and guest services. If you're headed somewhere to linger in your room, doddle with Room-Service and watch TV, you might find CQ too austere, but if you're headed out to see the sights, this is your place

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lawgoddess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Club Quarters last week on the 3rd floor. I had a decent view and a quiet room. It was a standard room. It was quite small but I enjoyed it. Very clean and well decorated; comfortable. They provide bottled water in the common area and have a restaurant and pub downstairs, which was quite good and had a great beer selection. The value was good and I was happy. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest for sleeping- bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: DivideByZer0
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Chicago for a 4-day business trip, and spent 4 nights at the Club Quarters in Chicago. Sleeping: The hotel is on main street, and is within walking distance of many parts of the city. Unfortunately, it is on a main street. The hotel rooms seemed to be limited to those on the street, and those above the dumpsters on the back alley. The room I ended up with was a small little room 9 floors above dumpster alley. I am not sure how often the trash trucks are in there during the day- I wasn't there, but I can tell you that they are in the alley off and on all night long. When the trucks are lifting and banging dumpsters you will be woken unless you have amazing ear plugs, or are deaf. The best night there, I was only woken up twice by the trash trucks. I can understand needing to not come into the middle of the city for dumpsters at rush hour, but do they really need to empty, pick up, drop off, re-position, and bang dumpsters at 3:00am? The other stuff- Not to be totally negative, there were after all some nice features of the hotel. My personal favorite was the handy fold out platform directly beneath the TV with hookups for my laptop. Given that I had a few hours to kill each night, it was nice to be able to lay on the bed, and watching streaming videos on the television using my laptop. The hotel staff, was universally polite, but never really struck me as warm, inviting, or particularly friendly. They responded to any request without complaint, but something in their manner always seemed to imply that they would have preferred that I not ask for anything at all. If I ever need to travel to Chicago again, I will not pick that hotel- Maybe some of the other hotels have better sound proofing...

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChriss
Reviews.Content: I had heard of Club Quarters before, but never stayed at one. Needing two nights in downtown Chicago, I found a room at the Club Quarters for an average of $169/night. Compared to other downtown hotels, this was an attractive room rate, so I booked it. I was pleasantly greeted when I entered the lobby. Check-in was fast and easy. Each time I dealt with the desk staff, they were friendly, helpful and very pleasant. There is a space referred to as the living room off the lobby, which has plenty of space to sit and talk, work or watch TV. It really was like having a living room in the lobby. I was told there were two business areas, although I used neither. Free Wi-fi (yes, free at an upscale hotel) is available throughout the building. I used it in my room and it was a strongsignal with good data speed. My room had a single queen bed, a desk, two bedside tables and a side chair. The bathroom had a shower and not a tub, which was fine with me. The room itself is smaller because it has just one bed, but there is plenty of room to move around or even have a couple of guests. The style is contemporary and has a warm feel, and it felt good to return to the room after a long day. Free, chilled and filtered water is available on each floor with plastic bottles to fill and take on the go. I really appreciated that effort. There's a restaurant attached (Elephant and Castle Pub), although being downtown, there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, including the Berghoff (an established and very good German restaurant). Likewise, there are pharmacies, convenience stores, and just about anythingelse needed for on-the-road travel needs. I also saw a Post Office and UPS store nearby. Being within the Chicago Loop, it was easy to get to a CTA train in several directions. I really liked the Club Quarters Central Loop, and the room rate, compared to other hotels, was affordable, especially when the free amenities are considered. I reserve a full 5 rating for truly outstanding experiences. This Club Quarters hits the mark on all counts. I would gladly stay here again. (CS)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MIShopperGirl
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay for a three day weekend in Chicago! The standard room, which is long and somewhat narrow, has a queen size bed. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We asked and received extra pillows without problem. The free chilled bottled water was nice. The hotel was fairly quiet. Wi-Fi was FREE! We decided not to upgrade since the standard room suited our purpose as a place to sleep. The price was right as well. Close to State Street shopping, plenty of restaurants, and public transportation. We stayed in another more expensive hotel a few days later for my husband's convention and the bathroom and sleeping area there weren't any larger than Club Quarters. We'll definitely use Club Quarters as a home base again the next time we're in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Dldds
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Pleasant staff. Rooms were very nice, but ours was quite small. I thought it was still a good value, because we paid less for the room than what I could have paid at a comparable hotel in the area. For 2 nights it was fine, and we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The location is excellent. Short walking distance to Willis Tower and the Art Institute. A bit longer walk to cross the river and go into the heart of the Magnificent Mile. Took a cab back home from the Water tower for about $10 including tip. There is a Starbucks right outside the front door and plenty of other places around for a good, close, cheap breakfast. I would highly recommend valet parking for the few extra dollars you pay, especially if you are checking in during the week as the traffic is insane and there is nowhere good to park your car to drop off luggage. If I wanted to stay in that part of Chicago again, I would certainly consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in the heart of the loop”
Reviews.Author: Doctorsassistant
Reviews.Content: I had a friend meet me at the airport, so I can positively comment on $36.00 Valet parking service with unlimited 24hour access. The room is spacious, with all the facilities of a well named hotel in the centre of the city. Ice machines, plus chilled water dispensing stations and free laundrette, compensate for no fridge in the room. Something semi common in different parts of the USA in hotels. The rooms are comfortable and spacious .Turning right, 10 minute walk to Millenium Park & Michigan Ave. Passing CVS, Walgreens and innumerable stores and restaurants . Turning left two blocks from the Willis Tower[Sears] and the hop on hop off trolley tour. The Elephant and Castle Pub linked to the Restaurant has meals all day, though the breakfast to me wasnt appealing, but my friend had the sausages, bacon, baked beans, eggs and toast AS I LOVE CHICAGO I WILL BE BACK !

Reviews.Title: “A real bargain for a superior hotel”
Reviews.Author: bill1766
Reviews.Content: This Club Quarters is a carbon copy of the others I've stayed at, Boston and New York. It's very modern, immaculate, and business-traveler friendly. Rooms are small, but the bed is big and comfortable and the desk provides good work space and lighting. Free wi-fi, including ability to print from your room and pick up your work at the hotel's business center. Comfortable seating in lounge off the lobby. Elephant and Castle restaurant adjoins the hotel (entrance right from lobby). Good location in the heart of the Loop, convenient to restaurants, shops and tourist attractions (very close to Willis Tower).The room rate was considerably less than what I've been recently paying at other good Loop hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great value, smaller rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict4ever
Reviews.Content: This was a very cheap room in a great location! A couple of blocks form the sears tower, a couple of blocks from the art institute of chicago. The rooms were a little small, but if that is all I have to give up for the price, I'll take it!! They have free internet, free printing, free water, coffee, and tea, and great service. I even needed something faxed for work and they were happy to allow use of the hotel fax for free to help me out. The place was quite clean. There was no refrigerator or safe in the room, which was a little annoying, but other than that, it was great! The parking costs 35 per night, which is in line with other garages in the area for 24 hour parking. I really feel I got a great value for the money in the heart of Chicago. The English pub restaurant downstairs was decent....not amazing but definitely decent for being conveniently downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lallen601
Reviews.Content: This was my trip back home to chicago for a high school reunion. I didnt want to spend too much money for lodging but again I did want to be comfortable. I wanted a clean updated hotel with the necessary amenities and this hotel delivered. I found no complaints at all about the Valet parking, hotel layout, furniture, basement lobby, elevator, room cleanliness and shower. This was the perfect hotel for me. When I do return to chicago I will definitely return to this hotel. Mr L. Allen Jackson, Ms

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Askren
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and staff were friendly. They charge $35 for early check-in, but they will hold your luggage before and after your stay for no charge. Rooms were nice but a little small. They were clean for the most part, but there were a few areas on the walls and doors that could have used a little attention. We paid $171 per night which for what we got I felt like it was a little much. Decent location, but you will have to take the bus or taxi to get to Magnificient Mile and Navy Pier (almost two miles each way). There were some issues with panhandlers right at the corner of the block. A two block walk to the parking garage, which cost $60 for 1 1/2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: travelrevi
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect sleep and shower hotel. It is clean, the bed is comfortable, the cost and location make it a great value. It is a no frills hotel that is built for the in and out guest. I stayed here for business and I would return. The room, bathroom and shower are all very small. The TV is small but everything is clean which is a major issue for me if it is not. The hotel is also very quiet which is great for business travel. The minimal staff are helpful but for the most part you check in at a kiosk and are on your own. The locaion in Grant Park area is great. Close to the train and walking distance or a short cab ride to most of the city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jr. Suite, but had to move from the basic room (simply too small)”
Reviews.Author: dennisrash
Reviews.Content: We were booked into a basic room (reservations made by our daughter). Since we had baby-sitting duties, we quickly found that room just too small. The front desk staff were very helpful in moving us to a Jr. Suite on the same floor as our grandchildren -- despite a very full house. The suite was ample and well equipped. I was also very impressed with the business-friendly conditions: computers linked free to printers; free wi-fi throughout the hotel; adjacent English pub/restaurant with reasonable service and adequate menu offering. The location is excellent: 6 blocks from Millennium Park and the Art Institute; excellent top-flight restaurants in easy walking distance; 1 1/2 blocks from the Blue subway that connects to O-Hare. Bottom line: good location at a value price with all the business amenities. A real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first timers”
Reviews.Author: ursulaob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for three days and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. It is within walking distance to everything, really close to the Willis Tower and Magnificent Mile. The room was really nice too. Only complaint was that our window was opague.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelingalot
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters is not your typical hotel, rooms range from efficiencies to closets. That said the closets (really small rooms) are dirt cheap. The hotel is clean, very clean, but has very little service. Don't get me wrong the staff that is there is great, but fortunatley there is a restaurant on property, where you can get help or just get service. This Club Quarter is located in the loop just a step from most of Chicago's greatest attractions and right on train, subway and bus wrotes, that will get you everywhere. If you do not need the bells and wistles and the cleanliness of the property is worth it wieght in gold... this is your property and you get the Location Location in the Loop, as a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: frazzledplanner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of an Orbitz package that I found so that I could go to the Chicago Blues Festival. This hotel was only about four blocks from the festival . The room was small, sort of like an upscale dorm room, but it was all I needed. I've been in larger hotel rooms that didn't utilize the space nearly as well. Staff was eager to assist with anything. They had directions and menus (with discounts) and free spring water available at the elevators. Being that it's located downtown there are hundreds of restaurants and clubs, tourist attractions, museums and transit. I took the subway from O'Hare to within a block and a half of the hotel for less than a couple of bucks. Best tip: Don't drive-CTA is cheaper than parking and driving.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: NickVal1010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CQ for a buisness trip. It was ridiculously hot and the air conditioning in my room was broken. I spoke to someone at 4PM and they said they would send someone up. - Noone ever came. I came back to my room at 10PM and it was still broken, they said they would send someone up - Noone ever came. The next morning I told the front desk everything that happened and they had the audacity to tell me they would have someone look at it. Finally they told me I could switch to another room if I wanted. No upgrade, no apology nothing - I am an easy guy to please but they made it seem like it was my problem. Rather than pack all my bags/etc and lug everything to another room I stayed in the hot room. The staff couldn't have been less helpful. I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cmo_matsuk
Reviews.Content: Great location, super new and clean! Super recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip extended for vacation”
Reviews.Author: stukellc
Reviews.Content: Location is 1.5 blocks from the Brown line (left) and the Blue line (right) with regular CTA buses and taxis stopping outside the front door. Walkable to the Art Institute and many other attractions inside the Loop. Loved the full suite. Except for one neighbor slamming doors repeatedly every morning, the hotel is very quiet and felt private. Filtered water and laundry access at no extra charge are a good touch. One non-functioning eliiptical machine in the Fitness Center, but otherwise nicely equipped. Enjoyed using the business center with free high speed internet and printer. Coffee/tea and apples were a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “Almost feels like home”
Reviews.Author: mike24830
Reviews.Content: For business trips with the Federal government in Chicago's loop, I try to stay in a place as close as possible to my meeting location. Fortunately, the closest option also happens to be a very nice hotel - especially considering the rate. The cost is very reasonable - especially for downtown. While it doesn't have a pool, there is an English pub (Elephant & Castle) through the lobby if you don't want to leave the building. There is also plenty of public spaces to get away and read if you don't want to stay in your room. Fortunately, the room is very nicely decorated and the bed very comfortable (I always sleep very well here - a rarity when I leave home!). One great little convenience on each floor by the elevators - a chilled water dispenser with free clear plastic bottles that you can take with you any time of day. Especially perfect on those hot summer days in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Fergadoing
Reviews.Content: Given the overall high Trip Advisor ratings for this hotel, it was very disappointing. On the positive side, the rooms were clean and relatively quiet for the downtown location, the location great, and the internet service great once we learned of its location the day we checked out. The staff, while cordial, didn't go out of their way to help us out. From the moment we arrived, we were stewarded to a computer monitor in the lobby that was used to check us in. Nothing was said about the lounge in the basement with computers, etc. The biggest surprise was that the basic rooms had only showers, no baths, and that one would have to upgrade to a suite to get baths, a frig, a microwave---items pretty basic one would assume would come with a room supposedly oriented toward business travelers. This became a particular problem for our elderly friend with rheumatoid arthritis, who needed a bathtub to soak in each morning. Luckily, although we were told upon check-in that the hotel was full, they somehow found her a suite with a bath (for an extra $30 per night); had they not, our entire five-day trip would have been ruined. In short the hotel was not bad overall, we just expected more from its website (which seemed a bit like false advertising); there was an overall penny-pinching atmosphere dictated by the owners, if not so much by the staff. (The hotel was grossly understaffed for the some 12 floors of rooms it included (only 1-2 people at the tiny front desk; no concierge to help us or make us feel welcome).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: katiemarg
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of Club Quarters before, but based off of the reviews on TA, am SO glad we took the risk and stayed there. First of all, it was under a $100 a night, which is unheard of in Chicago, unless you're seeking out hostiles. The location was ideal, within walking distance from the majority of the downtown attractions, including the Willis Tower SkyDeck, Millennium Park, the Art Institute and Buckingham Fountain. (Which is good, because we found the the subway line wasn't very helpful for tourist destinations.) The room itself, while quite small, was tastefully decorated, immaculately clean and very comfortable. I only noticed noise from other rooms on one night, the rest of the time you could hear a pin drop. We were on the 10th floor, so city noise was minimal and the elevators were insanely fast and you never had to wait long to get one. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. I liked the fact that there was a lot of serve-yourself conveniences, though I could see others viewing that as a detraction. For instance, you check in/out using an electronic kiosk, if you want an extra blanket or ironing board, you find a guest closet in the hallway and help yourself. They offered a gym, a "living room" to hang out in, and free bottled water on every floor at the elevators. The pub connected next door had very tasty and reasonably priced food. And if you need to park a car, we did the self park for $20/day (roughly $15 cheaper than just choosing a garage), which was a short 5 minute walk away, though they do offer valet if you so desire. The only negative I can come up with is the thermostat...it was impossible to figure out how to get the heat on, and the room was too chilly the whole time. We should have asked at the front desk as I'm sure they could have helped us, we just never made the time or forgot. Overall, I highly recommend Club Quarters the next time you're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept...we will try more Club Quarters!”
Reviews.Author: elainegaillard
Reviews.Content: SMALL rooms, big common areas and great amenities. Great location and great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great price!”
Reviews.Author: jazzgal24
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for first time to celebrate our birthdays. Picked out hotel on line. Turned out great. Convenient location ~ was able to walk to Grant Park and Lake; lots of shopping nearby; walked up Michigan Avenue and crossed the Chicago River; Willis Tower just 2 blocks away and, best of all, the train system was close by and excellent. Color coded and easy to use, we started out from the airport to the hotel via 35 minute train ride. Throughout our weekend we used our metro card. Even took the train to Wrigley Field. Our room was on the 9th floor of 10 and had been recently rennovated. On the small side, but plenty of room for a couple. Comfortable bed and bedding, beautiful bathroom. (Could've done without the see-through glass door though and could've used a vent in bathroom) Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful with questions and directions. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Defiantly coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Luvbigcity77
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff!! From the guys out front, to the people at the desk, to the cleaning staff...I can go on and on. We especially loved the guys outside, they are always so so so helpful! The room was better than expected, walls could use a new coat of paint. Other than that the room was great. I needed a fridge in my room and they got us a room with one. We came to Chicago for the city not the room anyone who complains about this place needs to get off their soapbox. My only complaint is the Internet is pretty bad so we used our iPhones. I have a MacBook air so I know it's not my device. But like I said earlier we came to see the city and not spend to much time in the room. Hubby and I both agree that we will do this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience: bad customer service and dirty”
Reviews.Author: rvp1919
Reviews.Content: We requested a crib before stay and arrived to none, no big deal. We called front desk at 3:30 and asked for one for our 6 month old she needed a nap badly after the flight. They said no problem. We called back at 5:00 and the lady was rude. At 6:30 we called again and still No Crib! I went to take a shower and cool off and it was dirty. It looked like it was not cleaned. Soap scum, hair and gross. We called front desk and told them we were leaving. We were suppose to stay three nights and this was our first night. They said to call the travel sight we booked from for a refund. We called and they called hotel and hotel said they were still charging us. Charging us for 3 nights when we stayed zero. I understand charging us for one but come on. Horrible, horrible customer service and dirty rooms. If I had the time I would stand in front of the hotel with a protest sign. terrible experience. Do not give them your money.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and nothing you don't need!”
Reviews.Author: Allisonbee
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters Chicago Loop is a gem! The location is perfect if you are looking to explore the city. We arrived from another hotel by foot and left for O'Hare by the blue line CTA which was conveniently located about 2 blocks away. There is a Starbucks right outside the hotel's entrance and the restaurant in the lobby is reasonable and quite good. The staff was very helpful. We checked our bags with the front desk staff prior to check-in and also after check out, which was great. The staff also gave us great directions and food and tourist recommendations. The hotel has lots of thoughtful touches---bottled water dispensers, coffee and tea available, a living room downstairs with large screen tv and internet desks. We especially loved our corner room which was a studio suite, complete with micro/fridge and kitchen sink. The room had a comfortable queen bed, a great stone and tile bathroom with shower, a desk and an extra easy chair for tv watching. Though compact, the room was spotless and very well appointed with nice linens and towels. We don't tend to spend much time in our room when we travel to a city like Chicago, so it was everything that we required. We felt good about being somewhat "green" during our stay. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers, vacationing couples and singles. The service, location and overall experience were top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location and met all of our needs!”
Reviews.Author: NurseJen97
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a 3-night stay with a group of friends. Every couple enjoyed their stay. We opted to valet our car due to our travel plans, this was VERY convenient and the car was ready each time we called downstairs in 20 minutes. The rooms were clean, comfortable and everyone slept well. We made use of the computer room with the free internet and printer. We enjoyed the bar attached to the hotel and daily used the living room on the main floor to meet with our small group. The bottled water came in handy for daily use especially when touring the city. The location was perfect in the loop district it allowed us to use the transportation system. We also found ourselves walking to Michigan ave and the magnificent mile quite easily. The rooms are on the smaller side but who goes to Chicago to hang out in their room? The only downside that we found was the lack of good restaurants closer to the hotel, however this was quickly overcome by using the transportation system surrounding usâ˜º. We all enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I like it, I will come back!”
Reviews.Author: porduna1
Reviews.Content: I went there for business trip and the hotel was clean, quiet and the room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the Loop, Amtrak”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference nearby. A quick summary: this is a clean, comfortable hotel that offers pretty good value if you need to be in the Loop area and Financial district, and is an easy walk to the train and Amtrak station. Still, I'd check for other good rates for area hotels. Room 802 is meant for a single. The smallish room is spacious enough for one, with a comfortable double bed. It looks out the back -- not a great view, but quiet and away from any street noise. There is good-size desk/work surface, easy-to-use flat screen TV, good sized closet, coffee/tea maker. Very good housekeeping and spotless, well-functioning bathroom with real glasses, nice toiletries provided and good bathtowels. This room has only a shower, no bathtub, but I chalked it off to the "good value" principle. The shower was a little under-pressured, but the wireless worked fine.. The irons and boards are across the hall in a communal closet. There is free bottled water for the taking. There is an Elephant & Castle pub-restaurant on site for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The bar has a lively (not raucous) scene in the evening. There is a good business center for free printing, including from your room. The area has a number of restaurants and shops, and is very close to some pricier hotels, e.g. a JW Marriott and a W Hotel. You are in the midst of the finanacial district, and the shops of State Street, the Art Institute of Chicago, the DePaul downtown campus, theaters, etc. are a short walk away. Still, there were some issues. There was no room safe. The heat in the room was a little warm, and I could not figure out how to work the room control well. The rooms are arranged off the hall such that two doors are very close together -- I could easily hear when the person next door was going and coming, although the rooms themselves are quiet enough that I never heard him/her when actually in the room. However, it was useful that these seemed to be a hall full of single rooms, i.e. no screaming children or couples carrying on loudly. The staff ar friendly, but there is room for improvement. I arrived early, and always understand if a room is not ready. I stashed my bag to get on with my day. However, neither at this time nor when I returned later in the day did anyone explain any of the amentities or services to me -- not the wine/snacks in the evening, not the coffee/tea available 24/7 in the lounges, not the business center amenities, not the Elephant & Castle availablility, etc. They checked me in and out, and no more. The info card in the room was useful. I looked into the lounge to see if the coffee there was any better than the typical room coffee. No, it was not, but the room was nice enough. 'Wish I could have had time to try the wine service at cocktail hour. There is the nickle-and-dime issue of a $35 early check-in fee. I just stashed my bag. I understand why "good value" hotels charge this fee that would be unforgiveable in more expensive hotels if rooms were available, but it's annoying. They also have a sliding late check-out fee. I tried the Club Quarters because colleagues at last year's conference stayed here and reported good value. It's pretty good for the area, but this year those colleagues got a great rate ($88 before taxes) at the Hyatt not too far away using Hotwire. When I did some research on Tavelocity and other hotel sites, the Club Quarters gave the best rate (others like the Hyatt, the Palmer House, and Kimpton hotels were $200 and over.) Next time, Hotwire may get my business, especially if I have no time to take advantage of the afternoon amenities. So: all-in-all, good value compared to the usual, but it encourages me to try Hotwire for next year's conference. I'd especially at least compare other options if I could not take advantage of the wine service in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in a SAUNA this is the place for you!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jtzuid
Reviews.Content: BEWARE the hotel is a sweat box. We stayed here well 1/2 a night after turning on the a/c and finding out from the front desk that it was hot or cold we left in the middle of the night at 1:00 AM. The room has a thermostat but, good luck it does not control the room temperature that is controlled elsewhere. TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Bus
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates if you are working in the loop. Room is nothing more than a standard business hotel, but good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value and excellent Location for our purpose”
Reviews.Author: WellBalancedFemale
Reviews.Content: We arrived in this rainy weekend for a family wedding in the heart of Downtown on the river. I was reluctant to spend the $200-400 to stay on the river and wanted to find something close to the Skydeck. I found this online and read past reviews. I called the hotel direct and was pleasantly surprised with the candid service and excellent knowledge of the area in helping us locate the wedding reception, how far we were from the shopping (within a short walk of the hotel) and the subway (blocks). The room was smallish, but we were there to explore Chicago and attend several wedding functions.The decor and service was Excellent!! There wasnt a pool but we ate bangers and mash at the hotel restaurant--food excellent. Service was a little slow. Potbelly was also a stop we made before heading to Sky Deck. Very good location if you are planning on seeing this.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was very good - clean and comfortable, and close to Amtrak Station”
Reviews.Author: mudloft
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent in most ways - I really liked the bottled water dispensers and the comfortable beds. The only downside was that $50 was deducted from our credit card and although it was supposed to have been reversed when we checked out has still not appeared back on our account 8 days later.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jotirico
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because 1. it was available and 2. it was close to the Federal Building. We needed to get to Chicago for passports and a snowstorm was predicted to hit the night before our early morning appointment. I was a little apprehensive as the price of our room was what we could call budget, particularly when you're staying downtown, but upon arrival we were pleastanly surprised. The room was exactly what we needed for our stay. It was quiet and comfortable. The staff was helpful and accommodating. The location was within walking distance to many things in the downtown area. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but construction across the street.”
Reviews.Author: Champurbresident
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel while in Chicago for work (one night each time). Â Both times I got a room with one king bed, which was very clean and comfortable but relatively small. My impression is that the hotel caters primarily to the business traveler, who does not need to stay in the room (or the hotel) for very long, but it can also be a great value for the budget-minded tourist who is looking for a nice and clean place to stay for a few nights. It is in the very heart of Chicago, within a short distance from stores, restaurants and only a couple of blocks away from subway stations. Irons and iron boards are available in communal rooms on every floor - but you might need help locating them. You can have as much purified water as you want for free from communal fountains on each floor. Â Printing and wireless internet is also free. The staff are very friendly and helpful. So a good hotel overall. BUT during my latest visit (early April 2011) there was construction going on across the street on the west side of the building, and I could hear the noise all the way up to the seventh floor... in the middle of the night! It was not terribly annoying Â  but enough to wake me up. So ask for a room on a different side of the building.Â

Reviews.Title: “High on customer service”
Reviews.Author: NVbeachfan
Reviews.Content: Got to the Club Quarters Central Loop around midnight and there had been a problem with overbooking and computer issues. They sent us to the Club Quarters on Wacker after many apologies and a complimentary night for a future stay. At the new Club Quarters, they reduced our rate by $10, gave us a river view room and since it was after midnight on a Saturday evening we parked in the free spaces across the street. Granted we weren't in our room for more than 7 hours but they realized the inconvenience and the valet and front desk were phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and cheap - good for solo business travelers”
Reviews.Author: rjayender
Reviews.Content: CQ at Central Loop is a preferred hotel of my company and I was 'forced' to stay there for a week. But the play was incredibly pleasant (even though the Chicago winter was brutal). Check-in was a breeze (possibly because I got in at 11pm and there was nobody at the lobby). Since I didn't have a laptop with me for the first day or two, I made use of their business centre which had great workstations. The room I had was quite small for American standards, but I found it perfectly adequate for my needs (I declined the upgrade to a suite for $25/day). The bathroom is also on the smaller side, partly because there's a shower - no tub - which is also something I prefer (although my colleagues were grumbling about this). Free wifi and a nice small LCD TV was good (although I would have preferred HDTV). A welcome voicemail from the manager is a nice touch. I wasn't too impressed by the fact that you had to use your keycard to use the elevator - was an annoyance I could have done without. The one other thing that didn't bother me while I was staying there was the fact that the rooms could do with a bit more humidity (was pretty dry in there). The location is unbeatable (just a couple blocks away from the Sears tower), and the price is definitely on the lower side. It was convenient for me to have breakfast and the occasional room service from the Elephant & Castle right next door (which is also connected internally from the hotel) so I didn't quite miss the fact that there was no in-house restaurant. All in all, pretty good value for money - but only if you're solo. If I went with family on a leisure trip, the $25 upgrade to the larger room might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago ... windy City”
Reviews.Author: Luka67
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent compromise price vs quality in Chicago. In down town ... close to everything Clean ... and with everything u may need for a short stay for holiday or Business Please notice ... for reducing cost they have introduced express check in and out ... so the only problem u may wait if u need concierge assistance in crowded Hours

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jimmy0226
Reviews.Content: Staff was very accommodating. Room was very clean, as well as lobby, elevators, etc. We asked for extra towels, which were brought to us right away. Our room was smaller than other big names hotels but served it's purpose. We also liked the free laundry faciliies and the free bottled water. We will definitely use Club Quarters again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend for Many Reasons”
Reviews.Author: TinaKay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked two nights at CQ for weekend of Feb 18-20. We were part of a large group of friends meeting for the weekend. The room was not large, but was adequate. Very clean. The decor was modern and clean. Bottled water stations were by elevators. Elephant and Castle downstairs was great for dinner and cocktails in the evening and quick light breakfast in AM. It's location is good. Only difference was proximity to the river. But it was only 10 blocks away so unless you need to be near river (we did-rest of group we were with were at CQ River/Wacker-I booked wrong location). Jessica at the front desk was a great representative of the hotel. Excellent customer service skills! Wendy in reservations was also a big help since we - oops - booked the CQ Loop instead of CQ River/Wacker.

Reviews.Title: “Last Stay at Club Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MsKTJ
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel early in the morning on NYE to see if we could check in early and was told sure we have plenty of rooms. Check in was quick. Valet was great. Then we get to the room. The room was VERY small. Not modern looking AT ALL. The closet and bathroom were so small you could barely turn around in either. It was unseasonably warm for NYE and the room was VERY HOT!!! We were not able to control the thermostat. We could hardly sleep. The bedding was the cheapest EVER. The televison only showed sports stations. The other stations did not have SOUND so if you like closed captioning guess you would have been okay. A hold was placed on my debit card for incidentals. When I asked how long it would be for the hold to be taken off, I was advised to call the bank..VERY rude staff..This hotel was inexpensive for NYE. I will NEVER stay here again...Guess you get what you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just another Club Quarters - Simple, Clean & perfect for business trip”
Reviews.Author: MattTripper
Reviews.Content: Nothing spectacular but like every Club Quarters hotel Iâ€™ve stayed in, it provided a simple & clean room. The reception staff or one of them in particular was rather blunt on arrival. When my card was rejected he refused to try again & was very rude. After making a quick call to my bank I found out that he had in fact entered my expiry date incorrectly. Finally he agreed to try again but there was no apology for his rudeness before. Anyhow back to the hotel. Good location and as always the chilled water machines on each floor are a nice touch. I would stay again for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: silvertresses
Reviews.Content: we stayed here the last weekend of August. The room (Queen std) was small, but quiet. Decor is Metro/European. Bathroom is VERY small, but quite functional. We were on 9th floor in the back, so not a lot of street noise. Front desk staff was very accommodating (early check-in, late check-out) and had great recommendation for breakfast. Location is middle of financial district, 2-3 blocks from subway stops, surrounded by historical buildings (fabulous architecture!). "fill-your-own" Bottled water provided on each floor (vry green!). Will most likely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “RUDE STAFF, AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: mksilverman
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as I sit in the downstairs business center of the hotel. I have yet to even check in and I am already writing a reveiw, if that tells you anything. My business partner has traveled to Chicago from Montana every month for the past year, staying at this hotel EVERY time. We called the day before our expected check-in (Saturday) to request an early check-in as we have meetings all day today (Sunday) and were hoping to be able to shower and get settled before heading out for the day. We were told we would be put on a list and hopefully get in early. I called again early Sunday morning but spoke to someone on the phone who was very rude. Now we are here at the hotel and told that it will be "hours" before we can get in because there are 10 people in line ahead of us and that the cleaning crew arrives at 9am but need a few hours to "prepare" their carts and start cleaning. I understand that rooms need to be turned over, but really, "hours". And for a customer who stays here a minimum of a week, EVERY MONTH! The men working at the front desk are rude and pretentious for NO REASON. I will make sure that our company NEVER uses this hotel again. What an awful waste of our time!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: sugartmp
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small (I opted for the lowest room category since I was traveling solo), it was sufficient for my needs. I was traveling on business and spent two nights at Club Quarters Central Loop. No noise issues, clean, secure hotel, close to many of the major companies in the Central Loop. It was a no frills experience, but considering how little time I spent at the hotel I didn't need all the extras or a huge room. Bottom line: It's a very good economical option in the Central Loop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Victoria5428
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights. My husband lost his very expensive new camera and the staff were so nice, they let us view all of the security footage of us coming and going out of the hotel. From that we were able to determine that he took it out of the hotel and we found it under the seat of the car. The next day I was a bit unhappy with not being able to turn up the heat in the room, so they moved us into a much bigger room with more adjustable heating controls at no extra charge. We loved the location and having the restaurant next door was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, affordable for Chicago..Everything you need for a holiday..”
Reviews.Author: muzotraveller
Reviews.Content: loved this place!...awesome location central to everything...walked to it from the Amtrak station with our luggage...block away from the L trains.....super close for catching the hop on off tour buses....only downside I can see is the room was a little small...but who cares...we just slept there....always had free cold filtered water available on our floor from a dispenser...you just fill up plastic bottles...excellent!....checkin and checkout was a breeze!...we paid $136 a night in July...i imagine it's cheaper during slower times of the year!

Reviews.Title: “Good location simple and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Andrea8673
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Chicao marathon. I chose it based on the location to the start and finish line and price. It was very nice place, but without all the luxuries of the bigger hotels. The rooms were smaller than I've stayed in before but it did the job. The location was great to be able to walk downtown or watch the marathon. The free water bottles were great. The staff was very friendly when we checked in. The internet was a slow connection but we were able to get connected. Overall is was a nice clean hotel in a good location with a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this little gem”
Reviews.Author: solisla
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Chicago as we extended a plane change by 24 hrs and booked this hotel with a bit of hesitation as it was quite a way down the list of most popular. Can only describe it as perfect for what we needed, we took a trolley bus tour from Sears/Willis tower which is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel, 3 blocks up and one over from memory. We took the metro from the airport (O'Hare) to the hotel and it is an easy option if you are on a budget. If I was to ctiticise anything the room was a bit smaller than expected but then so was the price. Clean and tidy, bathroom was excellent, no bath just a huge shower but that suited us fine. Staff friendly, warm and welcoming. We ate in the pub attached to the hotel and that was excellent value for money with staff helpful and friendly. We used a restaurant across the road for breakfast, turn right, across one junction other side of the road. Can't remember the name but good value. Starbucks almost next door and a CVS almost opposite. Would definitely use this place again, a good place to explore Chicago from.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to Union Station, Art Institute, State St shopping!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaDalisay
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this hotel, I have stayed there twice. The rooms are small but well appointed. Flat screen tvs, nice beds, recently remodeled. It is very business oriented, but it suits the leisure traveler, too. We usually go to Chicago for a weekend breather. Do some shopping and go to a museum. We take the train and use public transport or walk. This hotel is amazingly located for all the locations we love. They have a Starbucks around the corner (not open Sundays). State St. shopping is amazingly close. Millennium Park and the Art Institute are visible from the front of the hotel. The first time we stayed here, our room wasn't ready when our train arrived so they stored our luggage for free. The 2nd time we stayed, we arrived early and they checked us right in. There is a nice courtesy room off the lobby with free filtered water and wi-fi. Decent drinks at the attached pub, but did not eat there. I rarely find a hotel that is as nice as this place for $120-140 in downtown Chicago. I'l stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Mopane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine, in a decent location and at a reasonable price, but I probably would not have stayed here if my trip had not been last-minute and a lot of hotels had nto been booked. The rooms are relatively cramped compared to other comparably-priced hotels I've stayed at downtown, although they are clean and comfortable. It was also quiet and easy to sleep in. The staff was very friendly, but did not seem very familiar with downtown and was not particularly helpful with directions or recommendations. All in all this hotel was fine as a place to sleep, but if you are going to be spending any time at all in the room, I'd look for a deal at a different hotel. Also note that the parking is at a ramp a few blocks away--it was $20 a day for self-park when I was there. Wireless is free. There is not a fridge or microwave in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonaBoston_MA_USA
Reviews.Content: Nice clean, centrally-located hotel. Pleasant room was on the small side but clean and quiet. Nice feature, near the elevators on each floor was a cooler dispensing filtered water with a supply of 1/2 liter plastic bottles. Free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: WkndTraveller40
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! The staff were all friendly and helpful, the room was spacious (even though some reviews say rooms are small...we only reserved a basic size) and it was very clean and comfortable. The location was fabulous...within walking distance to much of Chicago. The Chicago Marathon happened the Sunday of our trip. Even though the hotel was very busy, the service remained great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and I will certainly be back. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Smallish rooms but still modern”
Reviews.Author: evanbr33
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here the night before and after the Chicago Marathon on 10-10-10. The room the first night had some sort of issue with the AC unit where it would make some scraping/metallic sound every minute or so; despite the fact that I told 2 separate employees about it on Saturday, they told me to 'check back later' both times as they were near or at capacity. The room itself was pretty nice; had a fridge/microwave, flat screen and a stand up shower (no tub). Little cramped in spots but it had everything we needed. After the race, I again complained to the desk clerk re: the AC unit and was immediately moved to a different room. He was apologetic and took care of the problem quickly. Hotel has a free gym, nice business type center and free (slow) wi-fi. The purified water on each floor was a nice touch too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Saltrat
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here in September 2010. Overall, this hotel is an extremely good value. It is new, very clean, and efficiently operated. It is also in a great location on Adams, just a short walk from the Art Institute, Millenium Park and other attractions. The hotel is nothing fancy and doesn't bowl you over with amenities, but one shouldn't expect that for this price in this great location. The only "ding" I can really give it is that my 9th floor single room had extremely poor wireless reception. So slow my iPad wouldn't even connect. Be forewarned: This hotel isn't smack in the middle of the action. The Loop is populated with office buildings and little else. If you want to be in the heart of the hotel/restaurant/shopping area, you'll need to take the 10 minute walk to River North and the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but missing some things”
Reviews.Author: olwick
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Central Loop hotel in Chicago. Itâ€™s a very good value in a fantastic location, but there are also a few things you should know about. First, the Proâ€™s: â€¢ Great value, considering the rates in â€œThe Loopâ€� area of Chicago. I paid $99/night. â€¢ The location is perfect for exploring downtown. Itâ€™s right between the Art Institute and the Willis (formerly Sears) Tower. There are multiple restaurants and services within easy walking distance. â€¢ Free bottled water. The hotel really seems to take the â€œgreenâ€� theme seriously. There are empty water bottles on each floor with purified water dispensers for you to use as much as you want. â€¢ The furnishings are relatively new and nice. Not overly luxurious though. Iâ€™d say theyâ€™re somewhere between a Best Western and a Westin. â€¢ There are free computer workstations to use for printing out boarding passes (see note in Cons though) â€¢ The hotel itself is very secure. Key cards are needed to operate the elevators as well as enter your room. â€¢ The attached Elephant & Castle Pub. Very good food. Not a huge menu, but what there is is very good. Plus you get your room service from there. â€¢ Free large chess sets in the lobby and lounge. Cons: â€¢ No safe in the room. This was a biggie for me as I had camera equipment I would have put in there. I asked the front desk about whether they had safe deposit boxes for use. They said â€œYeah, we can, umm, rent them or let you use themâ€�. Not overly confident. When I pushed further, they said they didnâ€™t mean rent, they meant just use. I didnâ€™t use them though as their answer didnâ€™t inspire confidence. â€¢ The â€œFree wirelessâ€� is exceptionally slow. I was there for 5 days (4 nights). Some days it was just okay and others it was virtually unusable. Note: The front desk was once again no help in troubleshooting any issues either: The in room instruction card tells you what network to join, but what it doesnâ€™t tell you is that you need to open your browser (Safari, etc) and accept their terms and conditions every 24 hours to have access. It will look like you have a strong signal, but you wonâ€™t be able to access it until you do that step. â€¢ The free computers to print boarding passes can also be excruciatingly slow. We tried for over an hour to print 3 boarding passes. We got 2 printed then finally gave up. Each web page was taking 2 minutes or more to load, then often failed and we had to restart at the beginning. I donâ€™t know if this was temporary or what, because the wireless that night was also super slow. â€¢ There is only one ice machine in the hotel. Youâ€™ll need to go to the 3rd floor to use it. â€¢ The lowest category rooms (standard rooms) are VERY small. Iâ€™m talking cruise ship small. The bathroom was so small that when I sat on the toilet my knees were under the sink. No, Iâ€™m not kidding or exaggerating. My friends had both the next room category up, plus one had a suite. They were larger and Iâ€™d definitely recommend going for the higher categories (although the suite really isnâ€™t a suite as itâ€™s all one room) â€¢ No refrigerator in the lowest category rooms. â€¢ No fan in the bathrooms â€¢ No movie channels of ANY kind (HBO, Showtime, PPV (of any kind)) â€¢ Valet parking only, and the valetâ€™s donâ€™t know any restaurants in the area, so donâ€™t ask them. So the bottom line is whether Iâ€™d stay there again. The answer is yes, but only in one of the higher category rooms and only if there wasnâ€™t a hotel in that general neighborhood that had safes in rooms with a similar price. Tip: Your GPS probably won't work to get you to the hotel once you're nearby with all the tall buildings nearby. Be sure to have printed directions or a map. Hope that helps, Mark

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Katiejam
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Small rooms with very hard beds, but good service. The pub is nice. Very clean. Provide bottled water free in the hallways. Very close to several metro stops. On a Sunday evening, you're in the financial district, and a lot of things close early, but otherwise excellent. Was great for coming in and out and seeing the city. Ride the trains!! beats walking! Their conference staff was a little lacking, internet wasn't very reliable, but I would rebook.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back, perfect for Lollapalooza in Grant Park!”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynEscapist
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of its proximity to Grant Park as we came to Chicago for Lollapalooza. Its about a 5-10 minute walk and very easy to navigate. It is also very close to the Art Institute, which we were lucky enough to enjoy for free (Thursday evenings from 5:30-8pm. There is a Starbucks right downstairs and lots of bars and dining options in the area. The room was clean and small. The free bottles of water on every floor were nice, there is also a business center where we printed our boarding passes and a laundry room with free machines and Tide for your use. We were able to wash all of our dirty clothes right before check out so we didn't have to do laundry when we got home. Very nice! Didn't use the restaurant or room service, however, the restaurant right off the lobby seemed to be very popular. We took the L train from O'Hare and it drops you 1 block from the hotel. No need to rent a car in this city. The hotel is perfect if you are looking for a clean space and don't plan to spend much time in your room

Reviews.Title: “Modest- but it was everything we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaCeeBee
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel, when visiting for 4 days with my best friend. We were very pleased with its central location, it was very easy to get around the city from there. The staff was GREAT, very helpful every time we had a question, I would say that is their best quality. The room wasn't large, but it had very large windows and quite a large, very comfortable bed. We slept so well that we overslept several times and had to modify our schedules! Overall, I have only good things to say about the Club Quarters, however it is a smaller more modest type of place so people who are looking for a luxury hotel will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gzawisza
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Club Quarters after booking on Hotwire. Although the room was a little small, we didn't spend much time there...the location was so great that we were really only there to sleep! It's about a 15-minute walk to the heart of Michigan Ave, 10-minute walk to the Art Institute and Millennium Park and its steps away from an El stop that took us anywhere in the city. We loved the free bottled water dispensers on each floor and the coffee bar in the morning. It's also right next door to a Starbucks, in case you need a morning espresso like I do. The only downside is that there is not a lot of late night options available, but that's the norm for the Loop! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters is an excellent value if...”
Reviews.Author: Cvanwisc
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters is an excellent value if traveling as a couple. This is not your hotel if traveling with the family, the rooms are too small. Quite a few nice touches, free wifi, free bottled water and a closet on each floor for extre pillows etc. CQ is nicely located, six blocks off Michigan Ave. and Grant Park. Lots of restaurants within walking distance and a Walgreens close for any forgotten items. Check-in was a breeze and the staff was very friendly. While the rooms are small, the decor is very nice. I will definetly stay here again, for the price it is hard too beat.

Reviews.Title: “Love Club Quarters”
Reviews.Author: ylind123
Reviews.Content: I am a female and often travel solo. I can't say enough good things about the Club Quarters establishments. I stayed at the one in New York City back in 2007 near Park Avenue and in April 2010 at the one in Chicago. Both were extremely pleasant experiences. What I like the MOST of about Club Quarters is their efficiency of space and practical setup. The rooms are the perfect size, the beds, bedding and decor cozy yet modern and clean. The free computers tailored for business travelers. The front lobby not shi shi but intimate, cozy and friendly. I plan to stay at many more Club Quarters across the country!! (onsite fitness center and restaurant too)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value, Good Location for Weekend Vacationers”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedWarrior
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for a weekend in Chicago especially if arriving by train. Within walking distance of Union Station. Rooms are clean and comfortable with all amenities. Some may have a view-ours didn't but that was ok. Nice to have unlimited free bottled water, Internet and access to public computers in Business Center. Within walking distance to theater district and many sightseeing attractions and a variety (both price and type) of restaurants. River North area and Mag. Mile may require a cab ride or public transporation for many people. Book a couple weeks in advance if possible for special rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable prices, good little "perks"”
Reviews.Author: aquila19
Reviews.Content: Like many reviewers have noted, this place is very central and close to many metro stops which was a huge plus. There is a 7-11 and Walgreens just a block away for those last minute necessities (or a quick bite). Check-in was fine for me, but not for my husband. He tried to slide his credit card in self check-in but it did not work. He had to get it done manually. We had rooms 824 and 835, both quite small although 835 had wrap around windows since it was a corner room. Both rooms had two twins and I dunno about anyone else, but they must have been tiny twins. None of us fell off our beds but we also were probably too scared to turn in our sleep! My friend and I woke up to cracking bones and sore backs :( I think the beds were just TOO soft. The walls are paper thin, so that you can hear everyone walking around the hallway as if they were in your room. You could probably hear us peeing outside of our room too, it was that bad. The front desk was friendly and nice. They provide free bottles where you can fill purified water on your own. There are microwaves, minifridges and coffee machines in allr ooms. There is no tub though, so those with kids may want to inquire about that. They have internet connection in each room (or so I'm told) and there is also a business center on the 3rd floor where you can check in and print boarding passes. There is a restaurant, Elephant and Castle, that is connected to the hotel. It is an English pub style, so if you like that kind of food, it will be quite convenient. There is no room service, but they do provide a service where you can order from restaurants nearby and they deliver up to your room for the typical room service fee. We didn't utilize this since most of the times we came home stuffed to the brim. This place is good enough for a short weekend stay. Very utilitarian.

Reviews.Title: “Small room - but very good”
Reviews.Author: Stone_xxx
Reviews.Content: The location is great - right in the loop. The rooms are very efficient - a bit small for america, but very clean and with everything you need. Big flat TV and free High-speed Internet. On each floor you get bottles that you can fill with free cold water from a water dispenser. Reception is very friendly -just 2 elevators which can cause a bit of a queue

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: moosefr87
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters hotel might be a bit expensive but its location is perfect: only 5-10 minutes from the Art Institute and Michigan Avenue, and the same from the Willis tower. The bedroom is of a good size, it's clean and there is Internet access. Breakfast was not included but there is a pub linked to the hotel to get it. There is a fitness centre but no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: UncleHoLondon
Reviews.Content: Found a very good deal on Opodo for a Friday and Saturday night in June (cÂ£55 a night). It has many good points: - great location in the centre of town - gym - free water - free internet Other than that i would say that it is comfortable without being luxurious. Perfect for exploring Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: rgberg
Reviews.Content: Nothing amazing, but clean and comfortable (and small) room. Free internet, free business services (for club members), great location.
