Best part was the check-in and check-out kiosks. We had no wait at either end, and didn't have to deal with a person. Makes life easier. The associated restaurant - Elephant and Castle - is horrendous. It's fine for a beer, but do not - I repeat, DO NOT - order food.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, unfortunate location”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyMD
Reviews.Content: I won't be staying here again. Customer service is horrible. There seem to be only 2-3 people working at the front desk area at a time, and they are usually so completely overwhelmed trying to check people in that they can not give proper attention to their other patrons. For example, they advertise free internet/boarding pass printing, but when I called to tell them the business center printer was out of ink, instead of fixing it, they instead directed me to the "club room" computers in the basement, where lo and behold, the printer also wasn't working...only then did they bother fixing at least that printer, and only after I'd had a long wait at the front desk as they checked in the aforementioned overwhelming crowds. The location is in a very business-y part of town without a lot of good nearby restaurant options, and good luck finding anything open around the hotel on a Saturday or Sunday...even the Starbucks shut down. That leaves you with the overpriced, but otherwise pleasant, hotel restaurant (Elephant and Castle Pub) where for example most of the draught beers cost $6.50 apiece, and none of the meals I ate there cost me less than $35 after a reasonable tip. This hotel may be cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good base for short stay”
Reviews.Author: ThePrests
Reviews.Content: Chicago wasn't cheap and this one cost us more than some others but it was fine. It is in a great location and was very clean. The laundry (free) was a bonus for us as we needed to wash by this time. The club room was a good spot for using their internet and hanging out. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I've found my new favorite business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MissDestructo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Club Quarters for a business convention. Staff was extremely helpful, Brett was always a smiling face at the front desk. Great above great room, very modern, cozy. Bathroom was immaculate. Quiet and I loved having water bottles at the end of the hall. Internet was free and fast!

Reviews.Title: “$40 USD penality for 98 minutes delay from checking out”
Reviews.Author: panacea1a1
Reviews.Content: The lack of hospitable receptionist and $1 per 2.4 minute stay beyond due checking out time ( i.e $40 USD per 98 minutes), deteriorate the strategic site of the city. So unless you are insensitive to hospitality and over charging, I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Close to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: smitr2002
Reviews.Content: My friends and I happened at this hotel because we used Priceline. We got the hotel for $50 night, which was an amazing price for a hotel this nice and downtown Chicago. The hotel did have self check-ins which at the time were not working, however the staff who checked us in were very friendly and quick. My one friend and I shared a room, which had a king bed. The room was very small but for anyone who has been to hotels in large busy cities, the rooms are always smaller. The room was very modern and clean. It had the basic amenities like hairdryer, coffee pot, shampoos, etc. It didn't however have an ironing board or extra pillows and blankets. These items were kept in a extra supply closet which is located on each floor of the hotel. The room also did not have a microwave or fridge. The hotel did have a filtered water dispenser on each floor with water bottles which I thought was very convenient. The hotel is located a few minutes walk to the Sears tower and Michigan Avenue. It is also about a 30 minute walk to the Navy Pier which on a nice day is a beautiful walk through the city and Millennium Park. The hotel did not have complimentary breakfast but it did have a restaurant attached. What I didn't like about the hotel were the sketchy guys who would get your car or a cab. They worked for the hotel however they would eye me up every time I walked by them and then speak something in Spanish and laugh which weirded me out. Besides the sketchy guys I would stay hear again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: KLK414
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for a Saturday night through Hotwire and were delighted to discover that it was walking distance from the Goodman Theater, The Museum of the Art Institute, and the train station, the three places we planned/needed to go. Our room on the fifth floor was small, but tastefully decorated in a modern style, and it was equipped with everything we needed including free wifi and a coffee maker. Other amenities included a comfortable king-size bed, flat-screen TV, desk, overstuffed chair, microwave and fridge. The bathroom had a large shower--no tub--and a blow dryer. The bathroom was fairly generously sized, though I wished there had been more counter space. Near the elevators was a purified water dispenser and a rack of empty plastic bottles for helping ones self. We were not disturbed by noise during the night, either from outside or inside the hotel. The lobby features two self-check in stations, but there were also friendly/helpful staff behind the desk for check in and out. There was a lounge, with a gas fireplace, off the lobby, where we waited for our bags to be brought down--the hotel was nice enough to keep them for us at no charge after we checked out so we could go to the museum unencumbered. There was also a restaurant/bar off the lobby, but we didn't go there. We did avail ourselves of the Seven-Eleven conveniently located across the street. It was all that was open late Saturday as we strolled back to the hotel after 11 PM. The Starbucks downstairs was not open Sunday morning, but there were a number of open cafes in the direction of the museum. The hotel is in an old, repurposed office building, but it has been completely redone. The hallways are narrow and the rooms are small, but this is a quality hotel. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills”
Reviews.Author: firefly90
Reviews.Content: This was our very first time staying in a Club Quarters location, and I must say that they do provide clean, comfortable (yet small) accommodations. I actually had an easier time getting over the size of the room, considering that many hotels in larger cities have smaller quarters. Yet there were a few things that had me a bit baffled. First, we asked for an iron (because there is no steamer if you want wrinkle-free clothes), and it took over a half hour to get one delivered. Second, there is no fridge, so if you purchase food from a restaurant downtown there is no place to store your food, nor a microwave in case you get hungry later on that evening. Not only that, there isn't even a vending area which commonly house the commercial microwaves like you'd see in an office lunch room. There's nothing! This is very inconvenient, especially if you plan on staying more than one night. Third, parking sucks!!! They validate your parking but there are no in and out privileges, so you're basically paying twenty bucks whenever you leave the garage. We plan on going back to Chicago next month, but will most likely opt for a different hotel further away from downtown. We figure we might spend more on the room, but we won't have to pay for parking and we might even have access to some basic amenities. Overall, if you're in town on business, need a quick place to crash-- by all means, go for it! Location is prime, you can walk to Michigan Avenue, Garrett's popcorn is about two blocks over...you're in the heart of everything. However, if you plan on staying more than a couple days, think twice. You might end up cramped and maybe even a little hungry because this is after all the definition of no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great price, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Freeagent35
Reviews.Content: Hotwire continues to impress me. Perhaps the most valuable part of Hotwire is that I have discovered hotels I would likely never have known about or stayed at. This is another example. I booked for a very good price. Upon arrival an upgrade to suite was available for $20. Since I was going to be here a few days I opted for an upgrade. The room is compact and efficient. I would not describe it as small. It is laid out very smartly with an extremely good use of all space for a high level of utility. For a family of four, it would have been tight, but for one or two it was just fine in my opinion. The room was clean and in good repair. Of particular importance, the room was very quiet. No elevator noise or noise from other rooms. I could hear a little traffic noise from outside (9th floor) but this was minimal. The suite also had a microwave, fridge, plates and such for dining in; a plus for the business traveler. Reusable bottles with filtered water dispensers everywhere is both handy and green. The front desk staff was great. The workout room is better than average and free. The location is about a 10 minute walk to Union Station making it a perfect choice for people taking the train into downtown for business or pleasure. Restaurant downstairs (English pub) was busy but very nice. It is not all grease as stated elsewhere, as I had salmon and it was very good. I definitely would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: hfla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. This is the perfect business hotel. They have a comfortable workspace in the room, and a very large downstairs work area including computers, work areas, conference rooms, and free print stations. There is also free wifi and free purified water. The rooms are nice and spotless, and the price is great considering what you get, and the going rate downtown. The rooms may not be considered luxurious, but are tastefully decorated, have a nice flat panel TV, and the bathrooms are very clean and modern. Although there is no room service, they do provide you with a list of restaurants nearby that deliver. So, you can get excellent food just as fast as room service (or faster). The location is perfect, too. This is my "go to" hotel any time I am going to the loop for work, and my backup hotel even when there as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: delicatelywild
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. It's a business hotel, but vacation travelers will enjoy staying here, too. It's only a few blocks from the Art Institute, Symphony, Millennium Park, and a lot of shops. Subway is also nearby, so you may not need a car. High speed internet is available for free in the guestrooms. There's no swimming pool. There's a restaurant and pub, but it's not very good, so I'd eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: dunwoodies
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here one night Valentintes day weekend after a Blackhawks game. We got a great deal on priceline.com. We were very pleased withe the valet service (valet & Parking is $29 NOT BAD for Chicago!) There is a self check-in which is awesome, the rooms are clean, bathrooms are ok, but clean and it gets the job done. The bed was comfy and we asked for more pillows and they were up to our room in like, 2 minutes. They have complimentary water bottles in all the hallways and lobby, and free interent and wireless in the lobby. No complaints here & definitly would go again for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: eaoct22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends when we were going to a conference at DePaul University in Chicago. We got a great rate and we each had our own rooms. The room was small but that was okay with the layout they had. It was nice to have the entertainment center on the wall with the place foir the computer and the tv, saving a lot of space. The bed was comfortable and the chair in the room was nice. The bathroom was very nice also, especially the shower!!! The only downside was the view was of a parking garage but I was not there that often.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good...”
Reviews.Author: hawk72rn
Reviews.Content: We got our room from a discount site. Though not exactly a hotel catering to young children, we didn't have any problems regarding that. Friendly staff, location ok. My only complaint is the bathroom in our room didn't get ANY heat, so it was really cold in there. We liked the free water in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price and location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingbell
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. It was clean and worked for what we needed (a place to stay while we were mainly out and about in the city) The room was small but we were in it to sleep and get ready so we really didn't need a larger room and for the price it was a great fit. The only complaint we had was the amount of counter space in the bathroom and the sheets were really hard (felt like paper). We are not picky people but we could not ignore the fact it felt like we were sleeping on paper :) Another point, make sure to ask for extra towels... our room was stocked for 1 person. 1 towel and 1 washcloth. Also there was no iron which wasn't a huge deal, my husband steamed his shirt with the shower on. The other complaint would be the attached reastaurant (Elaphant and Castle). Every waitress was rude (both times we went there) and were really impatient. We went the first time for dinner and it was so loud we couldn't hear each other so we got up and left. The second time was for breakfast. I tried to alter my meal bc of food allergies and the waitress was so annoyed with me I thought she was going to hit me in the face. The food was marginal and the prices were high. I would not rec. this restaurant AT ALL! I would rec. the hotel though!

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFrostyOne
Reviews.Content: Great location, reasonable conference rates, small but clean & tidy rooms, free wireless at a business hotel! Convenient to Blue Line Jackson station

Reviews.Title: “It's the Little Things That Make This a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: smumbs
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price. While the rooms are somewhat smaller than one might expect, it's the little things that count - especially when we are all trying to save a buck or two in this economy. Given the location, the room itself was the cheapest I had found. The rooms were clean and cozy comfortable. Now for the extras...Let's start with the unlimited free bottled water and then add the free wi-fi service on top of that. These days, other hotels are charging $10 for internet and $5 for each bottle of water. It all adds up. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There are several fast food and sit down restaurants nearby. The hotel is located right off of the Orange and Brown lines. Again, saving you money in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value on Weekends, Inside The Loop”
Reviews.Author: FairTaxBill
Reviews.Content: This mostly self-service property and small but very functional rooms create value and keeps their costs down. Really enjoy the morning breakfast, downstairs lounge and business center, filtered water machines on each floor, both WiFi and Ethernet for Free Internet. Most of the features are business-focused, as is the room design. Stayed at several of their sister properties in other cities...always a gem. Very clean, comfortable rooms. Front Desk is very friendly and helpful, with knowledge of local area. My colleague, a first-timer at CQ, really enjoyed it and quickly realized the brilliance for business travelers. N.B. Weekends tend to have more pleasure travelers, as is common with most business-oriented hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Love2getaround
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here, finding it a convenient location (access to buses and trains quite good), including walking distance to several restaurants and attractions, and an easy taxi ride to others we visited. The front desk staff invariably were courteous and accommodating, and a reliable source of recommendations for dining (including cards signed by the Concierge that were good for discounts and, in one case, two extra side dishes), using public transport, sightseeing, etc. The room we had was nothing special, and the view of the Post Office not all that inspiring, although it was clean and well maintained, and included a fridge and a micro. The housekeeping staff seemed unable to equate two people in a room for a week with the need for certain numbers of towels and washcloths, and never quite got around to providing more than one tea bag (but lots of coffee) each day. Nonetheless, these small inconveniences were quickly taken care of, and at one point the front desk cheerfully gave us a large bag absolutely crammed with coffee, tea bags, creamer, etc. Good, but quite noisy restaurant and bar off the lobby, and there is an excellent members-only club room downstairs. Check-in and out were quite efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy rooms and a great location”
Reviews.Author: kimlp37
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters was in a great location with only a couple of blocks walk to several trains, Millenium Park, the Sears Tower, and the art museum. The rooms are kind of small, but it was perfect for two people. The hotel was clean and they offer bottled water for free to all customers.

Reviews.Title: “Shottie-Billing Practice~Check Credit card statements”
Reviews.Author: BeachAdvisor09
Reviews.Content: Didn't really mind my stay;a good location,decent price & rooms.... a Pre-Paid package from Expedia. Chicago is an awesome city! That said,Upon my departure and sequencial Visa statement I was billed a 2ND time for my stay!...and Had to make follow-up phone calls to get refunded. VERY DISAPPOINTED...unsatisfactory customer service,lost faith in this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Vac4Sanders09
Reviews.Content: My family of my husband, a 6 year old and 3 children 18, 18, and 19, stayed at this hotel for the weekend. It was a great experience. The bedroom was smaller than we are use to, but it served its purpose with us having a safe, clean and comfortable place to sleep. The staff at the hotel was VERY kind. Being able to stay downtown for the price that we paid was absolutely great. I would recommend this hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MizBinky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in late August. It was my first stay but I anticipate staying here again in the future. My company has a corporate agreement with Club Quarters so I don't have much of a choice on where I stay while in Chicago on business. The only "dings" I can really give this place are regarding the front desk and the beds/pillows. On several occasions during my stay the front desk staff was more interested in discussing their personal lives than helping customers. I expected the standard issue hard bed and that's what I got. What I was not expecting was the condition of the pillows. When I went to lay down, the interior contents of the pillow moved to either side of my head and my head was literally laying on the bed. So what's the point of even having pillows? By piling both of them on top of each other and kind of rolling that into a ball, I was finally able to get a marginally acceptable pillow. As others have mentioned, this hotel is not going to put you in the middle of the action of downtown. If you don't mind some walking in order to get to Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park, etc. then you'll be just fine. Because it's more in the business area of town, it can be a bit deserted on the weekends and after about 8-9PM on weeknights. But I walked around by myself on numerous occasions during these times and felt perfectly safe. As for the room size, I had a room with one queen bed. It is small by US standards but if you're in downtown Chicago, you shouldn't be in your room other than to sleep and shower anyway! This hotel caters to business travelers so if you're looking for a spacious and/or luxurious room then should look elsewhere. Overall I had a pleasant stay at the hotel and for the price I had to pay, it cannot be beat for downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - a revelation”
Reviews.Author: chriswillow
Reviews.Content: We used Club Quarters at the end of May for the first leg of our Route 66 tour. Thanks to this hotel, our trip got off to a flying start. We booked CQ through Hotwire. Considering we were staying on a weekend, it was an absolute snip. The check-in was facile, while the receptionists were exceedingly helpful - a huge boost given our long flight from the UK. The rooms, by contrast to many reports, were superb, and of good size. A classy touch was the free bottled water available in the hallways - much needed on long days of sightseeing. Although CQ is a bit of a hike to the Magnificent Mile and the Hancock, Chicago is such a mesmeric city that it's hardly a chore. Valet service was fast, efficient and really good value. There is also a decent boozer attached to the side of the hotel, which was smart and contemporary. In short, CQ was a revelation and provided a nice feel-good atmosphere before the four of us headed to St Louis. CQ was one of the best hotels we stayed in on our Route 66 tour. PS: Seek out Lou Malnati's Pizzeria a few blocks away for tea. Breakfast should absolutely be spent at Lou Mitchell's, which is about 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Cinti_Jack
Reviews.Content: Rooms are smail; so if you plan on spending a lot of time in the room, don't bother. But very clean, great location and nicely decorated. I paid less than $100 per night - a terrific price. It is a short walk to Union Station and to Grant Park and to the subway lines. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “"Central" to downtown business district!”
Reviews.Author: FPMStudio
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Thursday night, and then again on a Saturday. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are small, but accomodations are clean and comfortable; besides, how much time do you plan to spend in your room anyway? The common areas (business and lounge) were very nice & spacious. The English pub on premises, the Elephant & Castle, has an excellent selection of beer. The hotel is 3 blocks away from The Chicago Institute of Arts & the Sears Tower; 5 blocks from Buckingham Fountain. The Blue & Red Lines are only a couple of blocks away. Free wireless access, but network is kind of spotty, and sometimes difficult to connect to. Overall, a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: QueenBee49444
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel we noticed a sign offering room upgrades for $15 a night. We did not take advantage of the deal until we saw our room. The lower portion of the window was frosted and the room was exceptionally small. It did however have a nice size desk and free internet access. Later, after occupying the room for a bit we asked if we could upgrade. The desk clerk said yes and booked us in a room with a bed, couch, table, fridge, sink and microwave. Probably 3 times bigger than the first room. The room was clean and well stocked with plates, flatware, iron and ironing board. The free filtered water was also a plus. The restaurant connected to the restaurant was very pleasant and staff at both the restaurant and hotel were wonderful. The hotel is only 5 blocks from Union Station and as a previous reviewer stated, less than 2 blocks from the "L". Lake Michigan, Grant Park, Millennium Park and other attractions are less than a mile away. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but modern.”
Reviews.Author: dmorell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on our last trip to Chicago. We picked this hotel because it was the one with the most reasonable price (hotels in Chicago are expensive!). The hotel is modern and looks pretty new. The rooms are very clean but small. However, we were rarely in the room, so that didn't bother us. The staff was very attentive and helpful. They also provide you with free bottled water which is an unexpected but welcomed amenity. The hotel also has free wireless and you can also print for free! The location is a plus because it is very close to almost every subway line. During the day, there is a lot to do around that area but at night it's kind of dead so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you want a decent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: alyhall
Reviews.Content: I was so excited after booking this room through name your own price after seeing the hotel's website and the decent reviews on the internet. Excitement led to disappointment after stepping foot into my room. The room is best described as a broom closet with a small (1' by 3') frosted window. No real light got in which made the room seem even smaller and more closet-like. The bed was queen sized, as expected, but once we got in the bed we realized it was lumpy and slanted. The duvet was also so disgusting it actually stuck to my hand when I moved it. The floors were of the same sticky consistency, I had to wear flip flops when I walked around. Ick! The bathroom was acceptable. The TV was, at most, a 20" screen that was difficult to view from the bed because it was so small. Things that I think should be in the room upon check in like extra pillows (there were only 2 in the room) and an iron/ironing board (this IS a "business" hotel) were stored in a "guest request closet" on each floor. Luckily there was an extra blanket and pillow as well as an iron, but no board, when I checked the closet. If someone went after me they probably didn't get what they were looking for. This hotel has a pretty good location. Right in the middle of the loop, you are close to most things you would want/need to do for business or leisure. The availability of restaurants/bars (except the hotels, of course) around the area after 9pm isn't too great because it is a very business oriented area. There are some great restaurants over on Michigan Ave, about 5 or 6 blocks away. For more ethic restaurants you will probably need to take public transport, of which there is plenty near the hotel. The blue/red/brown/orange lines are within 2 blocks and there are buses all around. The parking is $20/night self park validated by the hotel or $38/night valet. We self parked, the garage is well patrolled and we didn't have any problems. The price is decent for the area too. The common areas are nice and the fact that they have free in room printing was helpful, even though their printer (used for the entire hotel) was out of toner after 1 page printed. They also have free bottled water, you bottle it yourself in a common area. This place could be much better. The rooms are too small and too bare. I wouldn't even recommend it to business travelers who would be spending little time in the room because of the cleanliness issues with the floor and duvet and the lack of an in room iron/board and the crappy bed. We will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: myscreenname123
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice, cozy stay. Rooms are small and dorm-like, but have a pleasant decor and comfortable bed. Purified water dispensers with free bottles on every floor - this was a nice touch. Friendly staff. Hallways very narrow, dark and maze-like, and bathrooms have absolutely no counter space (odd design feature meant to make the bathroom look larger?). Morning room service very difficult to order due to busy phone lines - but menu was good, and apparently popular. Local restaurant delivery available, and can be conveniently charged to your room. Secure elevators require key card to access guestroom floors. Great restaurant with popular bar accessible from lobby. I was mistakenly placed in smoking room upon arrival - it smelled terrible, had small, jail-like windows, and was tiny. Staff moved me to a non-smoking room immediately - room was much larger, clean, bright, and had a large window. Overall, great for business traveler - very comfy to come back to in the evenings and desk had good setup, along with charging station. Wireless internet worked fine. Not kid-friendly - wouldn't recommend for a family or romantic getaway. Would be good for girls' shopping weekend. Great location and close to tons of shopping and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay there again for sure”
Reviews.Author: sinny111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my 2 days in chicago. It was right in the middle of the downtown, a couple minutes walk to the trains and the Sears Tower and a 10 minute walk to the lakefront. The hotel was really clean and the front desk staff was very helpful. My room was small but is more than enough for 1-2 people and was very quiet. I got room service both days for breakfast and there was plenty of variety from around $10-$15 (including service charges).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: loveshoes8
Reviews.Content: The room was exactly what was expected. No better, no worse. The staff was rude, and showed no concern for our comfort or desires. Just a few examples of the many problems that we encountered: At one point, we called downstairs for more pillows. We were told that someone would bring them right up. After waiting for over a half hour, we called down again and were told that they were out. When I asked why we were not informed the response was a cool (if not sarcastic) "I'm so sorry ma'am". One of the other problems that we encountered was our room key never seemed to work. Five different times we had to go to the desk to get it fixed. Each time seemed like a huge inconvinience for the staff to fix. There were many times when we would need to speak with someone at the front desk and would have to just stand there and wait. Never would they acknowledge us until they had finished doing whatever they were doing at the time. I would never stay here again or recommend it to anyone that expects good service from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: random_traveller_uk
Reviews.Content: Club quarters is a good deal for it's location. Right in down town chicago, you can get to Michigan Avenue , Millineum Park and Navy Pier really easily. Free interenet connection was very good, and on each floor they had a useful filtered water dispenser and bottles to fill up and take with you on your travels. Only down point is that check in desks are always very busy. There is a really nice diner right near by too , which I would recommend for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: hunny1978
Reviews.Content: We came to chicago for my birthday and stayed in Club Quarters Hotel. Seemed nice when we first got there. Then we get to the room. Extremely small, one chair, they said a queen size bed, but was pushing a full size bed, not sure it was even that big. The room wasn't exactly spectacular clean, our remote control was filthy dirty and barely worked, and when we asked for a new one the lady downstairs said with a breath and bit of attitude, ok someone will bring you a new one. No I'm sorry for being discusting, nothing. Also, you would think with what we paid for the room that we would have gotten a view, nope. The view was of the building next to us. It was just all around the worst hotel stay I have ever had. For what this place says it is, it is definately not. It is truely a total dissappointment. I will never stay there again, nor will I recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Good Ammenities, but Small Rooms; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NOLA_YNWA
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in a Club Quarters hotel, and I was very impressed. It was clean, the staff was pleasant, and it had nice ammenities - free internet, free bottled water, etc. The restaurant/bar downstairs was decent enough, and seemed to be pretty popular among non-hotel guests. The location is fantastic, near every train line and easily within walking distance of all the downtown attractions - the river, Michigan Ave. / Mag. Mile, the Art Institute, Grant / Millennium Park, etc. The only downside to this hotel is the small room size, but in my opinion I'd rather have a small, nice room than a large, poor-quality room. For the price I'm not sure you can get more bang for your buck in a city as expensive as Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Close Quarters - the room and Everything in the loop”
Reviews.Author: JJTJBQ
Reviews.Content: The rooms are compact, but well laid out. The bathroom is small, but functional. Our view was of an alley, but what do you expect if you stay within the loop? The valet's were great. It cost $30 for each 24 hours with in & out privileges. They asked that we give them 20 minutes notice when we needed the car. You could also self park for around $20, I have no idea where, since we did not see a lot within a block of the hotel in any direction. It was not noisy! We were just off Adams Street and had the leader of a marching band (college or high school?) in the room next to us. The only sounds we heard was when the band members left his room at a respectable 10 PM and when he left about 7:30 AM. When we saw the band check-in, with instruments we laughed about, "Hope they're not on our floor." When we went to our room and saw them squeezed into the room next door and spilling into the hallway we laughed out loud at our "luck." But they talked quietly and did not disturb us. Several interesting reference/list type books in the hotel room. They stock the room for a single guest, so we requested a second set of towels/washcloth. They were delivered in less than 5 minutes. There is a closet on each floor with an iron, ironing board, and other items a guest might need. It was the best hotel bar ever. Which may be unfair, the bar has a street entrance and a private hotel entrance. There was a large crowd at 5 PM on Friday, probably downtown workers letting traffic subside while they have a drink. We had drinks when we returned about 9 PM. They have some single malt scotches, but we saw bigger selections at places that did not advertise themselves as a single malt bar. The waitress was personable and hopping to keep up with the full bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service & great location”
Reviews.Author: SWRetiredTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about staying here, what with the extremes on the reviews (either great or very bad). Stayed 5 nights with a rate that I got on Orbitz (cheaper than calling the hotel, where you will reach a person in New York during regular hours); this hotel has corporate accounts, but I wasn't part of any company--just a tourist. Check-in took maybe 90 seconds--unbelievably easy, and automatic. I asked for a room as far away as possible from the smoking floor, and that request was accommodated. Yes, their rooms are small, but still larger than most rooms in European hotels! Nice desk with cables for your computer. The room was very clean and bed linens were crisp. The lighting could have been brighter, but, as usual, hotel lighting never seems to be bright enough in any hotel room, for my tastes. The lighting in the bathroom was great, though. No bathtub, just shower (fine with me), hairdryer. There is cold filtered water at the elevator end of the halls, where you can fill your water jug (they have the containers there). If you don't want to bring your computer--they have several in their spacious business center (open all the time), and you can even print out things following their instructions on how to do that. The fitness room was nice, with 2 TV screens in it so you can watch TV while on the treadmill or whatever equipment. I used it daily, and there might have been 1-2 other people in it at the same time. They had a stationary bike, elliptical trainer, 3 treadmills, a couple of weight benches, free weights, and one of those multi-purpose weight machines. I only ate once in the restaurant next door (Elephant something). They open at 6:30 AM; I thought breakfast prices were a little steep, but service was very good. When I walked by there in the evenings, there were always people in there. You can get breakfast for less in a couple of places within a block. Within a 2-block radius, there were 4 Starbucks that I counted and 2 McDonald's. There is a 7-11 across the street where you can get fruit. The front desk staff was SUPERB. Very personable, professionally dressed, and people who know what customer service is. I was going to be out when I needed to print a boarding pass, and I left my info with them, and it was done exactly as requested. They will also sign you up for various tours, which is a good idea (prices are same as if you had done it yourself), as various times for the popular tours sell out, and you are basically guaranteed a space. (Plus, you just charge it to your room, and you have a neat accounting of your trip.) The hotel appears quite secure--the elevator does not move until you insert your room card into a slot in the elevator and then you can press your floor number. Upon arrival, I took the CTA Orange Line train from Midway Arpt down to Quincy Stn (about 1 block from the hotel). That would not have been a problem except for one thing: There are no elevators for the most part at the old stations in the loop (the rectangular run of trains downtown). So I had to haul the large suitcase down more than 40 stairs on 3 flights of stairs (not an easy feat for someone with a purse and tote bag, too). If you want to take the train in ($2.25 vs. $22 airport shuttle), then get off at the Library station on the Orange Line, where there IS an elevator. (This will be a little longer walk, maybe 3 blocks.) Get your maps and other "tourist" brochures at the airport right in the same area where you get your baggage. You must purchase a fare card to get on the train. The fare card machines do not give change. The Sears Tower is 2 blocks away, Millenium Park is 6 blocks and Grant Park a little less. To save money, print out the "free attractions" in Chicago from one of the websites (can't remember which one). You can get the trolley at the Sears Tower location--go on the "Signature Tour" and hop on/off wherever you want. There are actually 3 tours on your ticket, so allow an entire day for it. You can walk to the Institute of Art (a must-see) from the hotel easily, and it is free from 5-9 PM on Thursdays. (You can take photos of the permanent collection but not of any exhibitions.) By taking this trolley tour, you can see where you would like to spend more time. Take the Architecture Cruise Tour (90 min., $36 adult, $31 senior). As for dining, there are lots of places (including the usual McDonald's, Subway, Dunkin Donuts, and many more) within a block of the hotel. For evening dinner, consider the Italian Village (1 1/2 blks northeast of the hotel, on Monroe), the oldest Italian restaurant in Chicago. The decor is very nice, and there are 3 levels of dining. Prices run $13+ for an entree on the main level, and the bread is delicious, too, and superb service. My friend and I split a salad and an entree, and the restaurant was happy to do that for us. Another place with wonderful food is Riva Cafe on the Navy Pier. Eat upstairs if noise bothers you (which I did); the view is much better, and you can listen to jazz music (not live, at least on Thurs night). Service there was superb. The mussels in the garlic sauce were perfect. There is a beautiful stained glass gallery collection in the long building where the Riva Cafe is, that is free. I also had afternoon tea at the Russian Tearoom, which is about 4 blocks east of the hotel on Adams, at the corner of Michigan and Adams. Very nice decor, and superb service, too. Nice selection of teas. The 3-course tea (savories, scones, and sweets) is average in taste. Their house blend of tea was delicious, though (berry flavored), and the little guy would refill your cup the moment you took a sip. This hotel is wonderfully located, and I walked everywhere, including to the Navy Pier, which is 2 miles away. Check to see what is playing at the Bank of America theater, which is 1 1/2 blocks from the hotel. I saw "Jersey Boys," and that was excellent. I was able to get a half-price ticket the day of the performance (paid $30), and said in the next balcony up from the main level. (Restooms are on the basement level, though!) Shopping is 4 blocks away up and down State Street and then onto the Marvelous Mile along Michigan Avenue. Stores on State, I noticed, were staying open until 8 PM. Finally, don't leave Chicago without taking the Green Line train ("L") to Oak Park, and touring the Frank Lloyd Wright home and studio and taking the self-guided walking tour (which is available in several languages) around the home. Beautiful victorian and Prairie style houses. The ride from the Loop is about 45 min. The food at Winberie's is very good, as is the service. It is across the street from Scoville Park, where there was a free music concert with a great band. (You would have to check schedules for the entertainment.) One last thing--there is absolutely no need to rent a car in Chicago. Besides, parking rates ran $16 for 20 min., and more than $30 a day at the garages. The parking for CQ is 2 1/2 blocks away! (I did not have a rental car.) The Chicago public transportation system is great. You can go online to www.transitchicago.com to get directions on taking the train/bus to anywhere. But as I said, I walked everywhere (and I am a senior citizen), between 4-6 miles a day. All in all, a wonderful hotel stay made more so by a friendly and customer-service oriented front desk staff, and a location quite ideal for tourists who want to be able to save money by walking to various Chicago sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: JoW2009
Reviews.Content: Room was dark but comfy. They had good facilities including wifi and auto check in. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, but not great”
Reviews.Author: titusnike47
Reviews.Content: I had two lengthy stays here for work, in September 2005 for four weeks and in January 2007 for two weeks. It's a pretty good location in downtown, within walking distance to the Sears tower, Grant Park, Michigan Avenue, and a number of businesses. It's also only a few blocks from the "L" subway system. On the downside, being located in downtown, the area is often pretty dead during weeknights and some of the nearby restaurants are not open for dinner. The Elephant and Castle Pub next to the hotel is convenient and good for drinks but the food is only average (English Pub food). The rooms were a decent size for downtown and had the usual amenities - TV, internet, etc. Some rooms have slightly weird layouts, but none are bad. The bathrooms only have a shower, no tub, if that matters. Most of the views from the hotel windows are facing alleyways and adjacent buildings. Overall, it was a good location for a business trip and is reasonably priced but it probably wouldn't be my first recommendation for a hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: weight100
Reviews.Content: The Central Loop Hotel is located in the financial district of downtown Chicago about 1.5 miles from Michigan Avenue. We found that we could go to the Navy Pier,Michigan Avenue for $7-$10 per taxi ride. It is not the Westin or the Omni but it was great for what we needed. We had a one room suite with a kitchenette. It had a over the range micro,u-line refer,two burner glass cooktop and a number of small appliances. We paid $115 per night. It was a bargin. The service was excellant. It was great for sleeping and being close enough to all the attractions that $115 a night was much better that $300 a night. You can take a lot of cab rides if you get my drift. It is worth your time to check out. Walgreens and CVS stores within a block of the hotel. There is also a 7-11 kitty corner and a Pot Belly sub shop two doors down. Pot Belly subs rule. Taste great and were cheap. This is a great hotel for the budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dso1uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights at the Central Loop hotel as part of our road trip across the US, The hotel provided a good location to visit Sears Tower (discounted tickets available from reception) and other Chicago landmarks. Check in was very quick, the room was a good size and clean, complimentary water and coffee. My only criticism would be the walls lacked sound proofing as we could hear the TV from the adjacent room a little too much at times. All in all though, a reasonable price for a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a few extra dollars and go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Outsourced
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance' decided to get away just before our wedding. Club Quarters offered a reasonable rate at a well situated locale...The good...check in was fast and the, tall, blonde haired guy working behind the desk was accomodating and super efficient...Kudos to him. Unfortunately, everything else was lacking. Rooms were of substandard condition. Due to the age of the building, the walls did not have sound proofing. The doors also were without air compressors so that they would slam when closed. I tried to take a nap about 3:30 and all I could hear were kids and adults slamming doors and running around. The room also had a thermostat which would seemed to be non-functional...Me and my fiance froze our butts off even after raising the temp to its highest level. I have seen better bathrooms in 3rd world hotels and no tub. My fiance got a workout moving furniture just so that she could find an outlet for her ITouch. We then decided to go get some pizza at Bucina's(sp?) which we saw in our hotel's restaurant advertisement book. Well, I asked for directions from the girl at the front desk who circled its approximate location. In reality, all she had to say was that it was at the Club Quarters north location which was clearly on the map. Thanks for having us walk in circles for 30 minutes.... At the time of our checkout, we decided to get some breakfast at the English pub next door. Don't even bother. We were hoping to get in and out fast so that we could get to the Field Museum...No such luck.. Waited for 15 minutes...no service I finally had to "tackle" one of the waitresses to find out what was going on. The end result was $6.00 for orange juice I never ordered, one slice of toast with the food, the orders were wrong, and stiffed when I paid the bill because the manager said there was no change? I actually went into the hotel to tell the front desk what happened and the girl who was looking gave me a beautiful smile and a blank stare. Unfortunately, there were few restaurants open on Sunday near the hotel otherwise I would have ran for the hills. In the case of the hotel, I ran for the exit.

Reviews.Title: “If all you need is a room - this is fine!”
Reviews.Author: Harrio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business in late may 2009. Hotel is well located in the Loop, 10min walk to State St and Grant Park. $35 in a cab from O'Hare Small, simple reception, all about getting you into your room fast. They do not offer much more there. Rome - decent sized, clean, simple and quiet. Bathrooms won't win awards for style, but were spacious and clean. No fridge, which is a let down if staying long and you would like to have water etc handy. TV in room with ESPN/News channels and the rest of the free view stuff. Comfortable bed too. Vending machines in corridors for snacks and free filtered water also! Elephant and Castle pub attached to hotel is busy at night time, with sport on screens and very good barmen. Reasonable priced for city center Breakfast is served in the pub and was nothing special, but plenty of choice, If bringing my girlfriend, I would probably stay somewhere a bit better, like the W Hotel across the road, but for business, and if you are not spending much time in the Hotel, this is perfectly fine and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Nat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 4 days and was extremely happy with the location and the hotel. Room was comfortable and clean. Loved the free filtered bottled water in the hallway. Staff tried to help me get some hard to get tickets but we had no luck. Close to everything I wanted to see. Had lots of fun trying to recreate Ferris Bueller's Day off! The shuttle bus driver didn't know it was called the "Central loop hotel" but this was easily rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: jkelley83
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the CQ for the weekend and couldn't say enough good about the hotel. It was the perfect location and the price was great. I could walk out the door in either direction and be right around the corner from where I was going. I walked to Michigan Avenue, Grant Park, and Millenium Park. within 10 minutes. Not to mention the free wireless internet& you are within 1 block of the L train. There were plenty of pubs/restaurants very close by. The hotel room was small, but very clean and sufficient for what I needed. I enjoyed having the mini-fridge, sink, and microwave. The check in/out took less than 5 minutes!!! They do charge you a deposit for incidentals..that they forgot to tell us about., but it was refunded immediately upon checking out. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: MonikaOregon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights. We loved the location--we flew into Midway, took the orange line in, walked a couple of blocks, and there was the hotel. It was also within walking distance of loads of great buildings and good restaurants. The room was small, but very well arranged to the size didn't matter. Our only complaint--smoking's allowed, so sometimes there was the smell of smoke in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: gert939
Reviews.Content: My stay was execllent, I was there with my daughter whom had a seminar to attend. The location to everything was great. I do have a question for you lost and found department. We stayed in 939 and I am wonderingf if a stran of beads may have been found after we left. They we 16 inches long and pink and white in color and about 1 inch in size each one. If found I will pay to have them sent to me.,... [--] Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: moper
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was recommended by the college my daughter was visiting. The location and price was very good. It is just a couple blocks from the "L" so we were able to take the Orange line from Midway airport to the Loop easily. The room was comfortable, quiet and I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others . However...the horrific overpowering cigarette smoke smell that permeates the 3rd floor of the hotel may make me think twice about that. Housekeeping tries to mask the smell with some sort of freshener which only makes the smell worse. So for future reference, ask for a non smoking room/floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ruth10
Reviews.Content: I only had a couple requirements on this trip - location, price and cleanliness. This hotel is five stars on all of those. I stayed in the hotel for two nights - my daughter and I were in the area looking at colleges. It was exactly what we needed. I booked our room through Orbitz for $85/night. One good thing to know is that Club Quarters Hotel is the same thing as Central Loop Hotel. You can book through either one, check in at the same desk, sleep in the same rooms ect. But pay more booking through Club Quarters Hotel vs Central Loop Hotel....it has them both in the title on this page, but they are listed separately in lots of other areas. Different phone numbers, different rates, but the same address. It took me a long time to piece this together. I booked a regular room online and asked for an upgrade when we got there. Nothing was available that night, but somehow she put us in a room with a king bed, fridge and microwave. (only queen beds were listed) So that was a pleasant surprise. Yes, the room was very small. But that didn't bother us. The TV was smaller and older and yes, across the room on the desk. But that also didn't matter. The hotel was very quiet, except I could also hear when the person next door came and went. We weren't in our room very much, and we didn't hear anything after 10pm. The halls are narrower than normal. Once again that didn't matter - the halls are regular halls - just narrower. Cold filtered water was available - and free - right on our floor. Very nice. Great Location!! We used the Metra and the L while in town. Sooooo close and easy to use! Easy walk to Grant and Millenium Park. Plenty of shopping and restaurants...it's Chicago!! The hotel parking is in a ramp a few blocks away, but once we parked, we didn't use the car again till we left town. I have stayed along the Magnificent Mile in the past, but this is gonna be where we stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, great comfort, great convenience, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Lawelch
Reviews.Content: I only visit Chicago every couple of years and always have stayed at the "big name, big box" places down the street from the Club Quarters while attending conventions. Now that I am self employed I have to look for value as well as convenience and name recognition. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. I was able to take the "L" from Midway directly to within a block and a half of the hotel and return to the airport. ($2.50 vs a $35.00 or so cab fare each way) The staff was very helpful in orientating me to the hotel, it's amenities and the local area. The room was perfect for my needs, a bit on the small side but everything was stylish and spotless. The work space was great with all sorts of connection cables as well as the free Wi Fi. I could have even printed documents from my lap top in the room using a centrally located printer. The adjacent restaurant was perfect and a great deal less expensive that the places down the street. Oh, did I mentioned that I was able to walk to all my meetings at, "the places down the street"? All this for about a third the price of the "places down the street".

Reviews.Title: “It's the architecture.”
Reviews.Author: OldArchitecture
Reviews.Content: We picked the Club Quarters first for price but mainly for its architecture. It's a wonderful Old Chicago building with visible stone and lots of details in the exterior architecture. The lobby is being renovated so we have to go back to see where the misterious stair that terminated in a wall will lead once the work is finished. It is nicely located across the river from the Trump thing which is all glass and while The Donald is not bad architecture, it's just not Old Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Favorite”
Reviews.Author: AnnGHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a business trip. This hotel is affordable for the loop area, but it does have some drawbacks. The room was small. There was a very small TV over the desk - the remote only seemed to work if you sat right by the TV - it did not work from the bed. The bathroom size was OK, but there was no tub - only a shower. There is no hotel room service, only menus for a couple of local restaurants that deliver in the area. I ordered dinner one night and it came without any eating utensils. There was also a $2 charge for calling the restaurant to order the dinner. The room was also noisy - you could hear every time that someone in the next room opened their door. Good choice if you are really looking for no frills, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: td397
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed this hotel. A few things to point out. The rooms are small - but like most large city hotels. The rooms though are very well appointed and have many amenities. This hotel is great for buisness travelers or singles - not for families and more than 2 people in a room. The decor is very contemporary, is new and comfortable. In fact, immaculate! The hotel offers many extras like free bottled water (as much as you wish), free wireless or wired internet, and several other nice amenities. The location cannot be beat. You may not have a great view, but I found the hotel to be very quiet. I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Perkster74
Reviews.Content: As others have commented, the rooms are small. I would recommend for a weekend stay, but not for longer than that. The room was very clean and the furnishings newer and modern. The bottled water on each floor was a nice touch. We had read a review that said the rooms had microwaves - - ours did not. When we asked at the desk, they said only certain rooms had them and they did not have one we could use. The location was perfect for walking around downtown. Everything we wanted to see was within walking distance, so we parked the car in the hotel garage. It was expensive, but what we expected for a downtown hotel. I would recommend this hotel for a couple's weekend trip. I would not bring small children unless there are some larger rooms available. This room was just big enough for two.

Reviews.Title: “I'd look around at other hotels”
Reviews.Author: CASECHI
Reviews.Content: Not a bad location and the hotel is in good shape. I love the idea of a self-service check in, but not after being assigned a handicapped room with a noisy alley behind me. The room was tiny, no couch and a small TV with poor reception. Check in with the front desk not the self service machine and make sure you are facing the street and not the not-so-lovely noisy alley behind you. The hot water was not very hot during the morning shower. The bed was not very comfortable and the linens were sub-Walmart cheap. For $100 to $125 a night this would be a good place, but not for $200. I'll stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: slr_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in t he heart of downtown Chicago. It is a modern hotel with most of the customary amenities. It is not a luxury hotel and the furniture is modern in design but plain. The rooms are smaller than we expected but very doable for travelers who do not spend a lot of time in a room. We really liked the distilled water dispensers on each floor and the large lounge with several public access computers and large screen television. The restaurant off the lobby "Elephant and Castle" served our needs for breakfast and dinner. It is a fine moderately priced restaurant. There is also a Starbucks adjacent to the hotel. Hotels in downtown Chicago are very expensive and our room was as a significant savings over the other places we inquired about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: argyjr
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters Central Loop was a fantastic hotel! It was very inexpensive compared to surrounding hotels and we were in the middle of everything. Here's the downside to this place: the rooms aren't very big. Don't get me wrong, they're adequate sized rooms, it's just that some people may be accustomed to larger spaces. The hotel is very neat & clean and everyone who worked there (that we dealt with) were nice as could be. We arrived late on a Friday night (11pm) and nothing in the area was open for food except the 7-11 across the street. We went over and grabbed some microwavable food and brought it back to heat up in our hotel room (microwaves in each room!). We realized we had forgotten napkins, utensils and paper plates. I called down to the front desk and within 5 minutes we had all 3 at no charge. Also, they offer complimentary filtered water on every floor, complete with 20oz plastic bottles to take it with you. Not something that's going to sell this place, but it was a VERY nice accommodation to have. The hotel is located very close to the Red Line and Blue Line subways. The Blue Line will take you right to O'Hare in about 40 minutes time. I highly recommend doing this if it's during the day. It's very inexpensive and convenient. The Red Line train will take you up to Wrigleyville. You won't have to walk more than 3 blocks to get either train from the hotel. There's a Starbucks next door, a Dunkin' Donuts a block away, a Subway nearby and lots of good restaurants within walking distance. The bar/restaurant attached to the Club Quarters in the Elephant & Castle. Excellent food, reasonable prices for a hotel bar. $65 for 2 people, drinks, dessert & 20% tip all included in that price. Bottom line is you won't find a less-expensive hotel that this in the Loop. It's convenient to everything and very clean. Shoot me a message if you have any questions. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: docmjc
Reviews.Content: I booked the club quarters based on our desire to stay in chicago without paying a fortune and without spending money on a car rental. The club quarters was perfect for this. The rates were unbelievably reasonable for a hotel on the loop. Its location about half a block from a blue line stop made it perfect for avoiding the need for a rental car. We were able to take the blue line from Ohare luggage and all without much hastle. We were able to access the entire city via the trains and the hotel is only a few blocks from the waterfront and millenium park is even within walking distance. The hotel itself is top notch. Nicely decorated. Free refillable water bottles with purified water on every level. Room was adequately sized, and the bed was comfortable. The kitchenette area was wonderfully convenient. Service was very good. Room was spotless and nicely decorated. Nice work area with both wireless and ethernet internet availalbe. Bathroom nicely appointed. I would and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling71
Reviews.Content: A very centrally located hotel inside the loop.Clean rooms,toilets and above all very safe.You need the room keys to access the lifts.they have a automatic check in system which was new to me.jsut insert your credit card with which you booked you will get the keys.If you are travelling by car they have valet services who could get your car in and out of car park any number of times a day.they have water coolers and clean bottles on all levels.we had a pleasant stay. Dont miss the speed boat ride from Navy pier its really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Too many better hotels to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: krhanson
Reviews.Content: A little background about the hotel: companies buy memberships, and then their business employees can stay there. You have to have a membership to stay there, however on the weekends, they open the doors to the general public. It is quite obvious that the staff do not like dealing with the general public, they treated me as though I was junk. The story only gets better! This is the first time I have ever gone into a hotel that Ive booked online and not been able to check-in immediately. Not that big of deal, I understand, it was just a little off-putting. The rooms aren't that big, but they arent too small either. You need to keep in mind that this hotel is intended to have its rooms used by single business travelers. There were only 2 pillows on the bed, and when I called for 2 more - THEY NEVER CAME! it was crazy! No call to tell me that we wouldnt be getting them, we sat there, and waited to go to bed, and eventually just had to deal with it. READ THIS: Then, the next day, as I was checking out, the valet brought my car up (after 20 minutes). I will admit that it is my fault for not thinking ahead, but I had no cash, and I completely forgot that I needed to tip him. He gets out of my car, and when I grab my keys from him, he says "oh, nothing for me?" I was seriously embarrassed and felt bad that I had no tip. I apologized profusely and told him that I had no cash on me. He says "really? nothing for me?" I'm still upset and apologizing. Not so much when he then says "oh, so my kids have to go hungry tonite?" Seriously? Is that really appropriate? I just paid $40 to have my car parked overnight - I don't think they need to hound me for a couple of bucks. I will never stay there again. It wasn't awful, the room was clean and comfy, the location was great, but the service all around was terrible. There are too many other hotels in chicago for me to even think of staying at the Club quarters again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable sleep, small rooms - no ammenities”
Reviews.Author: lindainmadison
Reviews.Content: Booked with priceline. Next time I'm going to target hotels directly on Michigan Ave. instead of this one on Adams and Clark and try to negotiate. It was just average value for what I expected. Having said that, for $120 a night in Priceline we felt lucky, since we found out while we were there, it was Lalapalooza and a Cub's game last weekend! Pros: Good location, convenient, clean, quiet, pleasant staff, microwave, mini-fridge, free refillable water bottles. Cons: few amenities for 4-star, small rooms, clunky tv/remote, small bathroom, no tub, no view. Because it's a business hotel it wasn't the type of hotel you'd want to stay to relax with some TV and go to the spa, just in case you were that type of 'getaway traveler' in Chicago. . It's a sleep. Nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Fit & Perfect Price for the Loop!”
Reviews.Author: ILTravelDiva
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at this location and each time we are happy with the stay, expecially for the price in the loop. In July we stayed here for my birthday and were on the 5th floor. I can tell there has been some reconstruction to the rooms and was glad for it. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom was plenty big. No tub, but the shower is so nice and big too. In each hallway there is a closet for extra pillows, blankets, iron, etc. and there is a closet in each room. Yes, the rooms are small, but still big enough for my husband and I to get around in. This is a business class hotel first and foremost, but we are in Chicago and there is always so much to see, no matter how many times I have been there. Also...we have stayed in Chicago many times and have stayed at some of the finer hotels and the rooms are not much bigger than what we had at the Club Quarters, and great service too. This hotel is right on the corner of Adams & Clark. A short walking distanvce to State St. Shopping Mall! There is a great british pub next door called Elephant & Castle. The bread pudding was devine, and they also have a website if you want to check it out before you go. There is also a Giordano's Pizza a 2 blocks away that delivers to the hotel. Not to mention a Starbucks on the corner right outside the hotel, a 7-11 across the street, and a great deli on Wabash called, "Ada's Deli". We always take the Amtrak train up, and it is only 4 blocks from the hotel. While there this time we went to see Blue Man Group! This was an incredible show and great for all ages, Go if you can. We will be back to ClubQuarters...I think next time we are going to try the one on Wacker!

Reviews.Title: “A Club worth joining”
Reviews.Author: DoeHEAD
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reading so many iffy reviews on Tripadvisor, but the moment I walked into the room my anxiety disappeared. Though smallish compared to typical modern hotel rooms, it was crisply clean and comfortable and, indeed, no smaller than the room I'd had at a 4-star Loop hotel on a separate occasion. I figured that the cost of our two-night stay at Club Quarters was about 60% of a comparable stay elsewhere in the Loop. Likewise, the reviewer concerns about the Club Quarters' location seemed odd, since we felt that this hotel was ideally located to accommodate our to-ing and fro-ing. Despite my 60 years, walking to the Sears Tower, the Ogilvie Transportation Center, State Street, the El, the subways, Grant Park, and the Art Institute wasn't unreasonable. It's also pretty handy to the freeways. Parking is in a self-park garage two blocks away, though the cost is about half of what overnight parking is at other Loop hotels. And valet parking IS available. A small sour note: though our check-in on a Friday afternoon and check-out on Sunday morning were quick and easy, the desk clerks seemed otherwise swamped with lobbies-full of travelers whenever we wished to inquire about something. All in all, this smart little hotel helped make our visit enjoyable and care-free.

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: lmrboise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable, attractive and had nice amenities for a very reasonable price. The reason I did not give it a 5-star rating is because the housekeeping services in the room were sub-par. I stayed for a week and the housekeeping service was worse each day -- by the end they were not bringing towels and not replenishing or cleaning the coffee service. Everything else was great. I liked the fitness room. There was a very comfortable work lounge with free refreshments that I used most evenings. They will print your documents for free through an online service. The desk staff was extremely helpful, polite and accommodating. My room was quite small but nice and comfortable. I had a fridge and a microwave which is very important to me as I don't like to eat out. I need to go to Chicago two weeks a year and I will go back to the Club Quarters!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the centre of Chicago, just a few blocks away from many important locations. The staffing is friendly but at bare bones levels, so it can take a long time to check in, especially in the late afternoon. The rooms are small and clean. The problem is the noise. There is construction going on and if you're in the wrong room, you're woken up at 7 am by banging and drilling. My room faced over the back of the hotel, right above the garbage cans, so I was continually disturbed at about midnight by trucks banging around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: 28Steve
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and and the rooms very luxurious if a little modern. Service is excellent. Only downside is location you are on edge of centre and it is a bit of a trek into the lively places. Not many bars, etc in immediate vicinity. Overall though good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but unique value-adds partially made up for that”
Reviews.Author: kironb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights early in June 2008 - booked online with Expedia. The Good: - Free filtered water & bottles - Good business desk and Internet access - Location - lots of good places to eat within walking distance - Reasonable fitness facilities - Great shower head on a hose The Bad: - Renovations on front facade and hallways - Very small TV that was not facing the bed area comfortably (got a sore neck from straining to see it - Fairly small room - not quite a Manhattan bachelor apartment, but not a whole lot of room to stretch out in

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CodyCNN
Reviews.Content: Right in the financial district safe area of town. Elephant and Castle restaurant is connected to the hotel, very good food. One thing to keep in mind is you get charged something like $15 to rent a hotel room a night that goes to the state of Illinois and the city of Chicago. Room was very nice, had a desk and wifi so I was able to connect my laptop and get some work done. Right down the street from the Sears tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, not so great location..”
Reviews.Author: erindalian
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed the hotel immensely. We booked on Expedia for $105 CAD per night. The room was modern, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The washroom was great...we loved the stand-in shower rather than the traditional bath style. The front desk staff was responsive and friendly. Our room was tidy and cleaned very nice daily. Our only non-recommendation is the location. It was located in the financial sector of downtown..approximately 15 minutes walking distance to Magnificent Mile, which is where all the fun places are! We felt very uncomfortable walking back to our hotel at night. If we visit Chicago again, we would probably stay at a hotel in the Magnificent Mile. Tips: - The famous Chicago deep dish pizza isn't all that great. - Cocktails on the Sears tower building isn't all that great either because the window seats are usually always taken. - The boat tour is a must!!! - Shopping was great in the Magnificent Mile area!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware - hotel is under renovation, choose room carefully”
Reviews.Author: CoCoffee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under renovation/ construction, the rooms had a stale musty smell, (we tried 2 differnt rooms) the hallway was very noisy (floor 4), combined with alley view and 2 am trash truck in the alley below. I think we had the worst possible room in the hotel - I now understand why the room rate was so good, I would rate this below a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love This Hotel and Service!”
Reviews.Author: tazsmama
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and was skeptical because of a few bad reviews. The construction is still ongoing, but this hotel's staff was over the top accomodating and went beyond common courtesy to assure my stay was wonderful. No dust or any incoveniences. I am a very critical person when it comes to cleanliness, and especially customer service. The staff was very helpful and informative. The room service was the fastest I have ever experienced, too! There was "always" someone available 24 hrs. a day and they were always extremely professional and well kept. I received help with personal items that did not require their assistence and they were the one's to make the suggestions that created more work for themselves. I will always stay at this hotel when I stay in Chicago. The area is centrally located and has many conveniences nearby, too. My room was a little on the small side, but it was perfect, including the cleanliness!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a one-night business trip”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGirl77
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through Hotwire for a conference and was fine with the hotel I 'won'. I have stayed the Club Quarters in San Francisco and expected a small room with limited amenities. I was surprised to see a fridge and microwave in my room. What a nice perk. Unfortunately the bed was horrible---there was a indent that resembled a bowling alley lane in the middle of the bed. And the pillows were so soft my neck hurt the next day.The service was fine (not extraordinary). I definitely recommend for a cheap one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business”
Reviews.Author: JTD72
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what problems the other reviwers are referencing. I recently stayed at Club Quarters and while I could tell they were renovating the renovation was being handled in a professional manner and I hardly noticed. I am a business traveler and I have experienced far worse renovations. Internet was perfect, felt very secure for downtown Chicago, room was spotless and bed was very comfortable. I could have paid $100 more down the street for a little more room but I felt I got a great value. Morenique and Aaron were incredibly helpful at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out early and moved to another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rickiboston
Reviews.Content: Renovation of the hallways and lobby? That means dust, fumes, and more dust. No one mentioned this when I booked. After a few nights of coughing, swollen eyes, and no sleep, I moved. Oh, and they shut down the restaurant for a week too with a day's notice. And the internet wasn't working properly so that my outgoing emails weren't being sent some of the time. Was there any offer of reduction in the price? Of course not. For just a few dollars more, I moved less than 2 blocks away to a hotel with a normal sized room, a much more comfortable bed, heat that worked, and really pleasant and helpful staff rather than people who were watching tv while I was talking to them about my problem. Never again - and I've stayed there many times - each time with one problem or another. It's cheap but there's a reason it's cheap. I used to say it was at least clean. Well, not this time.

Reviews.Title: “Construction woes at Club Quarters Central Loop Chicago”
Reviews.Author: emeritaprof
Reviews.Content: My partner and I checked into the Club Quarters Chicago Central Loop for a two week business trip. We were informed at check in that we would have to move from our first room on the 6th floor after a few days, as construction was scheduled to begin there. The hotel's plan was to move guests around as construction progressed: supposedly we were to be moved to a renovated floor. On the day of the room switch, I discovered that we had been moved INTO a construction zone. Renovations on our new floor had not been completed as planned: the ceilings in the hallways had no tiles--wires were hanging down, and pipes were exposed. Plastic sheeting hung in front of areas where construction was ongoing. The hallways had no paint or wallpaper--electrical sockets had no faceplates. The whole floor smelled of dust, paint, etc. Notes from the management to the guests before the room switch thanked us for our cooperation, but this was beyond belief--no hotel guest could reasonably be expected to stay in those circumstances. The hotel manager was upset by my complaints (I doubt if I was the only one to complain) and after some wrangling offered to move us to a Club Quarters about a mile away. We accepted the offer. I do not know whether the same offer was made to everyone affected. The hotel should never have expected guests to pay for such sub-standard accomodation. They should have delayed the start of construction on a new floor until rooms were ready for occupation on another floor. According to the management, construction will not be completed until June 2008--those considering staying at this Club Quarters before then--be warned!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Slag77
Reviews.Content: We had lowered expectations due to some of the feed back we read from other guests comments. It's true that the rooms are on the small side but the helpful staff and the location made up for the room size. There were three of us staying in the room so we needed a roll away bed. We needed to upgrade to a "Premium" room to have space for the roll away. The premium room had a fridge and microwave which were very handy for leftovers. The room was clean and in good repair.
