There was free bottled water at the elevators which was a nice touch. I'm from a small town and had some difficulty finding the parking garage which was approximately three blocks away. Joseph was working the night desk and walked a half a block with me to point the way. I was very impressed that he would go outside on a cold night to help me out like that. Note that the regular public parking rate is $38 a day. The Club Quarters will validate your ticket which will reduce your rate to $20 a day. We also came home early one day and startled our maid which threw her out of her routine. She was going to replace our empty Kleenex box and forgot after she scurried out of our room. I quickly chased her down to ask about getting Kleenex and she apologized four time for forgetting to leave a new box. We had nothing but positive experiences with all of the staff we dealt with. The hotel also offers complimentary wireless internet which was very helpful for checking schedules and activities for site seeing. The location was perfect right in the heart of downtown. We were very happy with the location and would surely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel remodeling in January 2008”
Reviews.Author: csh90069
Reviews.Content: This hotel was undergoing renovation in 2008, so part of the first floor was closed. The hotel was generally better than other Club Quarters I have visited in DC, New York and Chicago. The staff is very professional and attentive. The hotel also appeared very clean and well kept. Problems with my room were fixed on the day I reported them. This is a good hotel to choose if you are working in the financial district; many things in the area close down at night, and the usual Chicago attractions are far away. Nevertheless, the hotel connects to an "Elephant and Castle" restaurant, and there is a Starbucks on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: S-Dubb
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a few things going for it - 1) great location, 2) very clean, 3) neat pub on the first floor. However, it was extremely TIGHT. We wern't expecting a spectacular view but the view of the alley was a little grim. I am thin as is my fiance, and I felt like we could barely even get INTO the room. I think they may have coverted 1 room into 2 rooms all around the hotel. Also, there's no bathtub - just a small shower with a shower curtain that causes all of your water to leak out on the floor... I would not go back - much rather go to an Embassy Suites or a Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, few frills”
Reviews.Author: pobble67
Reviews.Content: Very central location in the Loop, convenient to trains, some good restaurants and adequate shopping nearby but this is basically a business district so unlike the Magnificent Mile area it's very quiet (= dead) at night. Although CQ is known for small rooms, ours was quite spacious and very clean with nice furnishings. It did not have a fridge or a safe, though. There was construction going on at the front of the building; management said they would put us in another room if noise was a problem but we never heard any. Room was a little chilly during the day but very warm in the evening. We had no interaction with staff except for checking in and out but they seemed to be OK. One thing that I really appreciated was that even though we showed up at 7:00 a.m. after a red-eye flight into O'Hare they let us check into our room right away, no hassles. Amenities included a computer room and small exercise room. Free coffee usually available in the lobby (but not always when construction was going on). Internet connection was available in our room (for a fee I think) but we didn't use it. All in all we were very satisfied, especially since we got a reasonable rate on the internet, and we were basically using it as a base for work and entertainment expeditions. But if you're looking for a place with the full range of amenities this probably won't be what you want.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but good”
Reviews.Author: tortellini
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about staying here since some of the reviews were not very good, but was pleasantly surprised when I was greeted by a nice lady at the lobby, who helped me check in using the kiosk. It's true... the room we stayed in was small (European-size), especially the bathroom, but for the price we paid on Hotwire, it was a decent accommodation in downtown Chicago. If you're a light sleeper, the slamming of doors might bother you, but you should be too tired from exploring the city to hear anything. Located in the financial district, it was nice and quiet after hours and a pleasant walk from Michigan Ave and close to the beautiful Millenium Park. Parking is a bit of a hassle since it's not on-site, but at $19/night compared to the average of $30-40/night elsewhere, it was ok especially if you're on a budget. For good breakfast, try Lou Mitchell's near Union Station as most cafes (not even Starbucks beside the hotel) aren't open on Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: kcalmole
Reviews.Content: I rate this ABOVE AVERAGE + Great location if you are traveling by train, only 3 blocks from Union Station. Very easy to walk to theater district and not a bad walk from Michigan Ave shopping. Star bucks and Elephant & Castle Pub are djacent with 24 hour 7-Eleven across the street. Small, clean room but it was very well laid out with everything we possibly needed. We saw much smaller rooms in Chigaco for more money. We got an excellent rate for tis stay at Hotels.com. Computers with Internet in the lobby were nice and the desk clerks were very helpful and polite. Would recommend for any single or couple going to Chicago for a visit. We are planning to stay there again in a few weeks .

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, very small room”
Reviews.Author: Sublimebrad
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip on Hotwire so I didnt get to choose the hotel. The location and price were great though for what was listed as a 3 star hotel. Im 6'4 so consider that before reading further. Everything about the hotel was small...the lobby, the elevator, the halls, the rooms. The room had a tiny bed, a tiny window, a tiny bathroom, and overall just very small. It wasnt bad since I didnt do anything but sleep there but it was easily the smallest hotel room Id ever seen. For the hotwire price I cant complain though. Hotel is within walking distance of the Sears Tower, Lake Michigan, Chicago River, and Magnificent Mile. Or you can take the subway to wherever you want to go. Not many places to eat around the hotel so you will have to walk several blocks away. Subway station is 2 blocks either way. Overall a decent hotel, more suited for smaller people traveling alone. I dont think any rooms have more than one bed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Efficient”
Reviews.Author: brimyn
Reviews.Content: A great location within walking distance of everything South of the river, where most of the business centers are located. Great food and theatre within a very short walk ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very Affordable, Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: SportCO
Reviews.Content: There are Pro's and Con's to this hotel. The front desk is awesome. Especially Joseph- He was super informative very very helpful. I called from O'hare Airport and asked how to get to their hotel. He gave me step by step directions that litterally took me all the way to the door. He booked a shuttle trip for me back to the airport, and instead of just telling me the information, that I may have forgotten, he typed it up. Anything I needed, he did his best to get me, or find alternatives. Hotel Pros. Automated Check In... Never seen this before, Thanks again Joseph Very clean rooms Free Wifi Friendly staff Cons. Super Small Rooms Pros out weigh cons in my opinion. I will stay here again. I will stay here everytime Im in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters- Terrible”
Reviews.Author: okiedokie2007
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. This hotel was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. 1- The hotel staff is EXTREMELY rude. I am a very laid-back low key person and I could not believe the rudeness with their personal conversation, gum chewing, and overall lack of personal care to me as I checked in, checked out or ask the staff questions on directions. I was hoping they would at least fake a smile or make eye contact. I would get better service from a comatose monkey. 2- Valet parking is a joke -- the valet was not at the front as I circled 4 times and called from the car to the front desk asking "do you have valet"? Finally he came out and than he stated to me "its $36 per night - you should save your money" WTF!!!!!!!! 3- Rooms were extremely small with a bed that was a little bigger than a twin bed. I'm thinking that's fine because I'm only paying $169 per night. The WORST -- they had put a feather bed on top of the bed to make it "nice" and all the feathers were pokeing through pricking my skin all night. I thought I was being bitten by bugs at first--- turns out it was the feather from the feather bed. No extra sheets nothing to put on top of that. I would never ever stay at this place. I stayed here because a friend mentioned that this was located to where I needed to be. NOT WORTH THE MONEY --EVEN IF THEIR RATES ARE CHEAPER---YOU WILL REGRET IT!!!!! THEY SUCK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Eh...I've stayed in better and I've stayed in worse.”
Reviews.Author: NYTracy
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago and we got the rooms on priceline.com for $100 per night. I went with 2 other people who shared a room and I had my own room. The room for two people had two TWIN beds. I couldn't believe my eyes! I have never seen twin beds in a hotel in my life. These were two grown men and they said they felt like they were in summer camp or having a slumber party. My first room also had two beds, but the front desk was very accomodating and let me switch right away to a room with one FULL size bed (also extremely strange to me). However, when i went down to get my room key, the front desk clerk jokingly suggested that I might be a problem guest and told me not to come back down to get a room with a view. And yes, I had absoloutely no view except of an alley and another building in my 1/4 size window. However I was happy enough to not have to sleep in a twin bed. The rooms were nicely and contemporarily decorated, but the overall hotel layout was still odd (like having to enter rooms on an angle, really small hallways, weird windows, tiny terrible tv). The stangest part of my entire experience is that they have a sign in the bathroom that says something about how to conserve energy and water, they will only replace towels every other day (also the same for bedsheets). However, if you would like them to replace towels before the second day, that you may place them on the bathroom floor and they will be happy to replace them with fresh towels. Well I decided i needed new towels and after the first night, i placed my towels on the floor to be replaced. After a long day, I got back to my hotel and went to take a shower. The hotel staff took my dirty towels but didn't replace them with any towels. I literally had not one towel in my entire bathroom. I called housekeeping, which apparently is closed after 5 or 6pm and got transferrred to the front desk. The front desk sent someone up with an incomplete set of towels in about 25 minutes. I found this to be an annoyance an inconvenience and for the remainder of my trip never put towels on the floor again for fear they would not be replaced. The last part I want to discuss is my checkout process. The purpose of my trip was business and one of the people I was travelling with had put the room on his company credit card. The day we checked out, we got caught in a business meeting and had to advise the hotel we were checking out late. Even though we told them we would be done and out by 3pm, they never told us there would be an incremental charge of $30 from 1pm-3pm and another $36 from 3pm-6pm and finally after 6pm another $216!!! We checked out at 5pm and when I asked them to place the charge on the original card, they demanded to see it (fortunately my coworker was still there). Plus I asked to pay for my room service on a separate personal credit card, which they told me would not be a problem and took my card. However the next day I checked my credit card statement and they had charged both the room service and the late room fee on my credit card and have yet to refund my money. The best things about the hotel were the centralized location, bottled water machines, the bar/restaurant connected to the hotel (which had last call at 12:15am on a Friday night - totally odd to a New Yorker), and the lobby had a lovely little room with internet and coffee and a tv 5 times the size of the ones provided in the room. But these nice amenities in no way made up for where this hotel was lacking. Would I stay here again? No. Definately not. There are too many options in such a large, lovely city to waste my time again at the Club Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Par........”
Reviews.Author: Wiscbabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Club Quarters loop location on the nights of Oct. 19 & 20, 2007. We got a rate of $95/night on Priceline.com. We were put in the "standard" room, which consisted of a double bed, small desk, nightstand, and very small bathroom. Our biggest complaint was the bathroom. It was so very small and cramped that we did not have any room to put our toiletries--there was one shelf that was about 5" wide by 20" long, that's it. Also, the bathroom did not have a fan, and there seemed to be something wrong with the flush valve in the toilet, as the toilet dripped water all night long. There was no iron or ironing board in the room. The room was quite noisy at night--you could hear the sound of traffic, sirens, and the L-train. Plus's --Front desk was very helpful, the room was clean. Probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J9p
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago to visit friends and attend the Taste of Chicago. This hotel was in a perfect location to this event. It was about a 5 block walk from the Taste, which was on Columbus Drive. The hotel was clean, very nice, and it was a very large room. I highly recommend staying here and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Nice rooms, Great Bed”
Reviews.Author: Funonewi
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We stayed for 2 nights. Asked for extra pillows and roll away and received them very promptly. Our room was very clean and modern. We got a room on priceline, so decided to upgrade to a suite. It was a very nice room. Not 2 rooms but bigger than other regular rooms. The staff was excellant. The beds were very good also. The only thing I don't like is you have to put your key in the elavator every time you go to your room. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: tinetan168
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews on this hotel, i expected to arrive for a room the size of a matchbox. But to my surprise it's larger than previous guests describe. Our room has a small kitchenette (microwave, sink, utensils, plates and a mini-ref). the layout is great and everything seems to be well maintained. There is a starbucks in the building and a 7-11 just across the street. This hotel is just a few blocks away from the blue line, so use the trains going into the city from the o'hare (just $2 one way! cheap!) The EL train stations are also close by so going to any tourist attraction is easy. Try buying the ride-all-you-can CTA tickets, it's well worth the price. With free wi-fi internet and bottled water. This hotel is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be recommended if you want the Loop and you can get a good deal. My single was small, but I've had lots smaller, and this was clean and comfortable. The shower (no tub) was odd, long and with a nozzle you can take down and use like a hose. The little fridge worked well, and there was a sink, tableware and a micro that I didn't need. You get ice and buckets on the third floor, which also has a washer and dryer (free!) and a couple of computers with Internet access with printers (also free). There are two more computers in the pleasant lounge, and you can get toothpaste and toothbrushes at the front desk. Location is the biggest factor, though - easy walking distance from the El for both airports, and closed to most Loop attractions. My one complaint is that you can hear your neighbor's TV if he has it on too loud. I didn't try the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel4545
Reviews.Content: We arrived by subway in the middle of the day. The ride was a bit long (55) minutes from O'Hare, but it was cheap. The Jackson (blue line) was only a block away from the hotel and we had no problems finding the hotel from there. From exiting the subway to being in the hotel room was approximately 10 minutes, check in was fast. We stayed on the third floor, view wasn't spectacular but it was nice. The room was clean and seemed to be well kept. The room wasn't huge, but hey your downtown what can you expect. We did not mind the smallness of the room because we only planned on taking breaks and sleeping there. We really enjoyed the location of the hotel. We were only a couple blocks from the Sears Tower and from the red and blue lines. The location made it easy to travel anywhere fairly quick. We had a great stay and would definitly recommend this hotel. I plan on returning to Chicago in the near future and will stay at Club Quarters. The price is definitly better than some of the other downtown hotels. I am fairly picky about cleanliness and I did not have any problems with Club Quarters. The hotel is well kept and efficiently run.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find-efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: San Diego is best
Reviews.Content: Using Trip Advisor, I booked my stay at Club Quarters thru hotels.com. It was $40 less per night than any of the other hotels I was considering and close enough to walk to my business meeting location. I was able to take the Metro Orange line from Midway to the Loop, exiting on Quincy. The hotel is 3 blocks away, saving time and cab fare. A small lobby and needing a room key to access the elevator contributed to both the private club feel and a sense of safety. As noted in the other reviews, the room is quite small, but contained all the essentials-a comfortable bed, a work desk, free internet access, cable TV. Same for the bathroom-small but efficient and with all the essentials. I ordered dinner in from the restaurant downstairs-The Elephant & Castle. Good fish & chips that were delivered within 15 minutes of ordering, piping hot. Starbucks is on the corner, although the hotel has complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning. 7-11 is across the street. Great location, good prices, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HBSponger
Reviews.Content: Last week, I attended a national conference in Chicago. The organisation that puts on the conference was supposed to obtain a hotel reservation for me at any one of a number of places, at its reduced, negotiated rate. This never happened. So at the last minute I was forced to look on my own. If you've been pricing downtown Chicago hotels then you know the horror I discovered. After calling a handful of the hotels on my conference list and being told that a room would cost, at the least, twice what the conference rate would have been I went to the on-line services. There really wasn't anything downtown offered except the Club Quarters. I read through some of the poorer reviews and most seemed to settle on the fact that the rooms are very small. There were some pictures posted and these seemed to bear out the descriptions. But I was to be there on a conference and had a good schedule of activities planned out in the evenings, so who needs a big room? The room was exactly as the posted photos indicated. The bathroom was very clean and I had the exact bed spread in the photo. If you've stayed in mid priced European hotels then the room will not seem too small. Service workers in Chicago - in general - are not friendly. The counter staff here are a bit better than average. But the cleaning staff and the restaurant staff are very nice and helpful. The size of the room helps in keeping it cool, which was nice to come back to after trapsing around downtown Chicago in July. The door staff seemed to be attentive of people coming and going and there is an added safety feature of needing a room key to use the elevator. I did not order food, but there are four different restaurants with menus posted in the room that will deliver to the hotel. There is no garage. I don't mention this as a criticism, only as a comment. The hotel is so nicely located that if you are at all ambulatory, you could stay here and never need a car. The Red Line CTA station is only a few blocks away and from there you can come in from the airport and get to almost anywhere. I could take it to my conference, to blues clubs, restaurants, and even Wrigley Field to catch a Cubs game. At half the price of the "cheaper" downtown hotels, next time I will save myself some hassle trying to get the conference hotels and look for a CQ deal.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok.”
Reviews.Author: Owensfam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on a business trip in May. From the airport, we took the El which made for a long trip. The walk is nice from El station to the hotel. The lobby is gorgeous, especially the lounge and the pub that is attached. However, the room was no bigger than a closet. There was barely room to move and the lights did not work. Because I was exhausted from the business meetings, I settled to just turn on the bathroom light to go through my things. Had my husband come with me, there would not have been enough room for the two of us in the room. You could only access the bed from one side and the T.V. was hanging over the desk, so only one person could see it. The air conditioner ran all night, although I had turned it off, and there was a strange trickling noise coming through the vent as I tried to sleep. On the bright side, the bed was very comfortable with nice pillows and soft sheets. In the end, I don't think I would stay here again, unless I knew I could get a bigger room!

Reviews.Title: “I hear the Club Quarters!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vargawesomeness
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. It was clean, comfy and well laid out. You can even bottle your own water! Staff was friendly and the pub downstairs was good food. GREAT LOCATION and has an EL station close by. We will SO be back

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced,Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kwebsnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters Central Loop for a long weekend vacation. As many have noted, the rooms are small, but efficiently laid out so it was not a problem. Rooms were clean, staff were courteous. It seemed the neighborhood was much more business oriented and many places were closed on the weekend, but it was a very short walk to many more 'touristy' sites. All of the trains stopped within a few blocks so you could get anywhere you wanted by el or by walking. One thing to be aware of is the king size bed was actually two twin beds. The bed was very comfortable unless you laid down in the center, and could get an elbow stuck in between the two mattresses! I thought a queen would have been more comfortable than having the line down the middle. All in all, it was a good hotel for the money, and I would stay here again if I could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: micdenver
Reviews.Content: This hotel was half the price of the downtown competitors. But it stacked up to every good hotel I've been to. If your looking for pampering service this isn't it as the desk folks are polite but busy and preoccupied. However the room is clean, well kept and comfortable. The associated pub was not impressive for breakfast (a bit greasy) and I heard some leaving from dinner commenting on how smoky and loud it was. Just down the block was a restaurant called We which I thought was very good and a very short walk. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good central Location”
Reviews.Author: STEVEFR
Reviews.Content: This is a moderate priced hotel for Chicago where prices can get rather high. The rooms are small.Not tiny but yes small but they are clean and well maintained. For a short city or business stay they are perfect. I was here for shopping and served the purpose perfectly as the location is great / safe and in easy walk of city central areas and the mag' mile. Metro/train to airport is very close by within minutes and is on the central loop. I would stay here again. It is a functional hotel at reasonable prices comparied to other locations in downtown area. Bar restaurant on location / next door but did not try but was always very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...keep reading for more info”
Reviews.Author: Eyeluvpets
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical of staying here after reading some of the reviews on the size of the rooms.....we had two rooms. The club room and a superior room. The club room was on the small size, but not as bad as people made it out to be....and we spent hardly any time in the room so it really did not matter. The superior room was an average size of most hotels rooms. It had a sitting area/desk and kitchenette whereas the other room did not. The hotel was clean, had free access to computers/printers, nice club room in the lobby with daily papers, game, flat screen TV. On your floor you have access to endless amount of free water bottles! The location was great, 4 blocks from the park and 2 blocks from the train and state street where shopping is. I would defiantly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place + Cheap = Best Deal Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MexFanColorado
Reviews.Content: We were headed to Chicago for a long weekend at the end of April. We didn't want to spend a lot on a hotel because our flight was free and we felt like bumming around near museums & architecture, not shopping on the magnificent mile. We found the Club Quarters - Loop on Travelocity. $99 a night sounded too good to be true, but we figured if it sucked we could go somewhere else. Even though the W was only a block away, we had no reason to leave the CQ. The location was great - easy in/out from Midway and since you're in the Loop area - you're one hop away from the entire city. The CQ looks like a clean, efficient business-oriented hotel, with nice furnishings, only 15% smaller. The room was smaller, but had plenty of room for the two of us. The lobby was a little narrower than most hotels - the hallways (on 7) seemed a little narrower, but not claustrophobic. The employees seemed regular size. There is a Starbucks in the building and a pub restaurant as well. The financial district can get slow on the weekends, so it was nice to have these 2 places open nearby. Of course 2 or 3 Dunkin' Donuts are within walking distance, so we didn't go hungry. The CQ was popular with some younger kids the weekend we were there - talk of bachelor parties and clubs wafted around our floor. But the room was quiet. I can't recommend this hotel enough to folks who are budget travellers, or those who typically stay in nicer hotels (I was planning on the Burnham before I found the CQ), but aren't so fussy they can't "rough it" for a few days (but it didn't feel rough).

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: CB05
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one week-end night and it was a very pleasant experience. We had a room for $130, a great deal if you consider the location of the hotel! Sweet price for the quality of our stay. Our room was clean and spacious, the place was very quiet and relaxing. The people working at the front desk did not seem very warm and friendly. But is it important to mention, when the job is done correctly and in a time-effective manner? The hotel offers two types of parking (everybody who already drove in Chicago knows that finding a parking place can become an expensive nightmare...): a self parking just two blocks away for $20 per 24 hrs (only drawback: no in-and-out privilege) and a valet parking for $36 per 24 hrs (but you can request your car as many times as you want). We chose the valet parking and everything went fine. We have to return to Chicago next month and will definitively book a room in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: We were panicked because a huge convention gobbled up all the rooms in Chicago. Luckily, I found the CQ at a great rate. We took the Orange line from Midway, exited at Quincy and walked around the corner right to the door. GREAT! A very friendly staff here welcomed us, hailed taxis, gave directions, etc. Funny thing, one poster mentioned that they don't explain using your card for the elevator. Lucky for me, this happened a month ago so I was aware! Our room was 529, in a corner, no view. The bottom half of the window was frosted for privacy. At first, I didn't like it, but if I wanted to check for rain, etc, I could stand on a chair. The blinds worked well keeping the room dark and it was quiet except for the normal door noise. The room seemed brand new- no stains, torn furniture, etc and supremely clean. The sheets were okay, but the pillowcases were deluxe! The room was small and had very limited storage- two drawers in the desk and a closet. There was no iron. No frig or mini bar, but there was a coffee maker and real ceramic mugs! There was an easy to use digital climate control. No tub, but a spacious shower with a great removable shower head. Only a small countertop and shelf for storage. There was a swivel makeup mirror in the bathroom and a small hairdryer. TV was 25" and placed on a table on an angle, but it had free HBO, Showtime and rental movies. I was pleasantly surprised at the workout room. They had 4 Cybex treadmills, a Cybex elliptical, one True elliptical, 2 bikes, one regular, one recumbent. They also had free weights, a few machines and space for floor work. The room had 2 TVs with channels listed on wall. They also had a scale, water machine and towels. We didn't eat at their British pub style restaurant ,the Elephant and Castle. They didn't serve breakfast, btw. The menu was pathetic for vegetarians with only one entree- a veggie burger- no meat free salads or pasta. Hey, you're in Chicago, better choices are a short walk away at any time! Another nice touch was a water and bottle dispenser by each elevator. Bottom line, you can pay lots of $$$ for spacious rooms, toiletries, etc or you can save your money for great shopping , restaurants, etc and stay at a place which has all you need. If you stay longer than a few days, you might miss the storage space. However, I'm used to living out of a suitcase and was a very satisfied guest at this place! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room...great deal”
Reviews.Author: traveler_from_indy
Reviews.Content: I got this room for 149.00 per night. Great deal considering it was right in the central loop! I must have gotten one of the biggest rooms on the floor; it was right by the elevator... I was only one person; so I would have been happy with a small place. Updated decor and I had a mini fridge and wet bar, with a microwave and coffee maker! The bathroom was a little small (no counter space) The room right by the elevators is pretty loud, but I am a deep sleeper so it wasn't a problem at night. Plus the bed was far away from the side where the elevators were...by the window. BTW, the bed was very comfortable, I probably got better sleep there, then I do in my own bed! My view was of the ally and I could see the people in the office buildings pretty clearly... but I was only there for business, so the view didn't matter. There was a nice desk to set up my laptop and also the wifi worked great! The only problem we had with the cards going up to the elevator and getting in the room; they didn't explain that to me, and maybe that's the norm in Chicago and other big cities.. but I had no idea and the doors shut and luckly there was someone in the elevator who told me what to do. Then the cards stopped working and I (along with other guests) had to get our cards (re-magnitized). They checked IDs when they did that, so I felt confortable that they did that... The doormen and front desk people were very nice and helpful, if I looked lost, they would help me. There is a Starbucks downstairs on the corner, which is nice. I walked to the Sears Tower, and many resturants near by. I would stay again! Thanks Club Quarters!

Reviews.Title: “Location good, hotel acceptable”
Reviews.Author: London_bird
Reviews.Content: Booked through Orbitz and $80 a night for a weekend we really couldn't complain. Hotel only a couple of block from the subway (blue line brings you straight from O'Hare for only a couple of dollars each). In the business district so a little quiet at the weekend and you will have to walk up town to find a more varied selection of bars/restaurants. Elephant & Castle pub/restaurant attached to the hotel good for a drink if you like fake British pubs. Food not great and we found it rather smoky but it was an easy option. Our room was small by American standards but perfectly adequate for 2 of us (1xQueen bed). We were on the 6th floor facing Adams Street (I had asked for a high room having read previous comments about noise). I think the 8th floor is the highest. The hotel was really quiet and we had no-one next door to us. Whilst simple modern decor I thought the room (bathroom in particular) looked a little tired & could do with a repaint. The bathroom was very small and we had a shower (no tub) - not a problem but to be aware of if you have children or are larger than average. Only 2 pillows on the bed and we wanted more. Room instructions said they were available in the "Guest Amenities" closets located on each floor. We had a look in the closet and found 2 pillows but neither had covers on and both were stained (nice!). Room would have benefited from a safe for guest use. Ours did not have one. Machines on each floor with empty plastic bottles and dispensing drinking water to fill them with was a nice touch. Staff all very friendly. We were there on a particularly cold April weekend and the concierges always opened and closed the doors behind us. Front desk staff always acknowledged us coming in and out. Felt reassured by requirement in elevator to use room key to operate it - a good security measure. Whilst not understanding the previous reviewers full situation I can't really comment but I was interested to note the observation that it took over an hour for the concierge to find the person a chair. There is a large guest lounge just off the lobby where we saw plenty of seats. Failing that there is a bar/restaurant off the lobby on the other side. Perhaps this was a different hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Rudest concierge ever”
Reviews.Author: MHS_FL
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 days at the Club Quarters. Excellent location for people interested in architecture, the bedroom was dark but spacious and clean. When coming in and out of the hotel the concierge would not answer to my greetings. On the last day I suffered an accident at breakfast (outside the hotel) and when I came back from the hospital, groggy and using crutches, the doormen did not even helped me to get out of the taxi or held the heavy doors of the hotel open for me. I had to wait a few hours for the shuttle that would take me to the airport, and the concierge failed to arrange me a chair and a glass of water. I had to ask 5 times and wait almost an hour for a chair, and gave up on the water. I was exhausted, in pain, I explained that to the concierge, and he barely looked at me, treated me as if I were a worm. Any good hotel would have pampered a person in distress, but Club Quarters service was particularly rude and uncivil. I wrote them a letter afterwards, the answer was not properly apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: sylndoug
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in downtown Chicago for just one night - myself, husband and 5 year old son. After a quick, courteous check-in we got to our room and found out we didn't have a sofa sleeper as requested (for our son). I called the front desk and he said to come back down and they'd have a different room for us right away. We were fortnuate and did not hear any internal noise nor any noise from Adams Street. The room was a little small for 3 people if you planned to hang out for a while, buy why do that when you're in Chicago! The bathroom was spacious, well equiped and clean. The little kitchenette and desk were perfect for a couple or business traveler. It's an easy 4 block walk to the Sears Tower. The El train is even closer. Quick, courteous check-out. We would defintiely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located Freindly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PrincessVic
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Hotwire.com and was a bit leary at not knowing where I was going to stay. I went to Chicago for the Bears Fan Convention March 31 to April 1, 2007. After I booked on Hotwire, Club Quarters came up. I had never heard of the hotel and was dismayed to see they want a credit card deposit for incidentals. I do not have a credit card. Once you book on Hotwire, you can not change your booking. I called the hotel and was told, no problem, just leave $50 cash. (On arrival, the front desk lady told me it was $50 a day. I told her that's not what the guy on the phone said. I had no problem paying, as I had the cash on me. I was about to give her the $100 when I asked about a Bank of America ATM. She gave me the location and then said it was for telephone use and movie purchases. I laughed and said I was in town for the Bears Fest and I have a mobile. She said to give her $60.) I arrived quite early for check in, 9am to be precise and check in is at 3pm. The staff was able to find me a room and check me in any way. I was told it was a smoking room, but could NOT smell any smoke. I even sniffed the curtains and no smoke smell. The room is VERY spacious. I estimate it to be 17 ft by 8 ft. The bed was quite comfortable and the temperature of the room excellent. The shower is also quite large and I had hot water on demand. The bathroom and room itself were really clean. There is free internet access in the business center. The business center on floor 3 next to the ice machine and vending area is small. There is one computer and one printer. I only needed to use it twice and did not have to queue up. The only downside to my stay: the rooms are not sound proof and I could hear what seemed like every door opening and closing nearby. But I did NOT hear any of the traffic on Adams St. The staff were freindly and courteous. My deposit was refunded to me in full when I checked out (I didn't use the phone or the TV - I was busy with daBEARS!!!! ) The hotel is centrally located, plenty of bus and el routes nearby. It is within walking distance to all major sites in the loop area. There is a Starbucks next to the hotel and a 7-11 across the street that is open 24 hours a day. There is a Bank of America with an ATM a block away.

Reviews.Title: “BEST value ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: happy2getaway
Reviews.Content: LOVED LOVED LOVED the Club Quarters in Chicago! The location was easy to get to from O'Hare (close to the CTA - take the Blue Line to Monroe and walk 2 blocks). Staff was very helpful and informative. The room was very comfortable, clean and offered wireless Internet connection. Definitely the best value in town (booked through hotels.com -- cheapest weekend rate in the city). I highly recommend this hotel for all travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters is my new Chicago home!”
Reviews.Author: JoelR-MichaelK
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Inexpensive (compared to most downtown Chicago hotels), convenient location, and a great room. I have read other reviews that complained about the size of the rooms; my room was perfectly big enough for me and would have been fine for two. The bed was great, comfortable, the room very elegant and servicable. Small but very well-appointed bathroom with a HUGE shower. Plenty of storage throughout room. Room and entire hotel was clean, clean, clean. Great eatery attached (English pub) with great wait-staff, or you can order in and have food delivered. Valet parking reasonable and convenient (and pleasant attendants). The hotel was full of students that night, but my room was 100% quiet. As a very frequent traveler I highly recommend this hotel. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: ekevitz
Reviews.Content: I also booked this hotel through hotwire.com and got the room for $127 on a weekend when the Bears were playing. After booking and finding out I was staying here I read the reviews and thought the room was going to be so tiny, but the room was definately a normal size hotel room. The room was very clean, smelled good and the location was excellent. Each day we walked to the train station which is just about a block and a half away and we traveled to different parts of Chicago and we were close enough to walk to Soldier Field and other downtown sites. I would definately stay at this hotel again and overall I had an excellent experience for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Business/Budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: ttheuriet
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through my husband's business, since that's how most Club Quarters work. Although he'd stayed at this hotel several times in the past, it was my first experience here - and my husband's first experience there in a non-business capacity. Overall, the room was much smaller than I expected -- typical for a property that caters to business travelers. But the shower more than made up for it! It was a HUGE space, with a nice showerhead that offered good water pressure. The rest of the bathroom wasn't as big, but it was ok. Not much counterspace, though, especially since the coffeemaker took up a lot of room! Our room had also had wireless internet, a mini-fridge, decent-sized closet, loveseat-like chair, and a queen-sized bed. We didn't spend much time actually in the hotel, but what we did see of the lobby and restaurant were very nice. Service was professional, if not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters Chicago Loop Review”
Reviews.Author: Mskay
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I stayed here for 3 nights in November (got the room on Hotwire, payed $198 plus tax per night). It was clean, quiet, small, quite ok for a business person, but it was a bit claustrophobic for 3 nights for us. Every employee we encountered was very polite and helpful. My only real complaint is that every night about 4:30am we were awakened by a loud banging sound. We mentioned it to 2 employees, who had no idea what it was, but a maintenance man was walking by and overheard us, he said it was the sound of steam pipes being turned on too fast. Other than that, a very good stay. Elephant and Castle had fish and chips that melt in your mouth. Hotel is in a great location, if the price is right. Berghoffs and the Grillroom we highly recommend. Had dessert under the Christmas tree in the Walnut Room at Macys, saw the King Tut exhibit, Shedd Aquarium, Art Institute, even got to attend a taping of Oprah. Ginos East Pizza is excellent. Had a great time, stayed an extra night at another hotel, will review separately. All in all, loved Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “great place for short stay”
Reviews.Author: eab1313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Chicago for a theater show and wanted to stay right downtown, but for a reasonable price. We checked into Club Quarters in the afternoon and walked around. The hotel room is small but very clean and modern. Everything we needed was right there. There is an attached English bar/restaurant that was very good. Would recommend highly if just in for short stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a great location”
Reviews.Author: katespade
Reviews.Content: Ok, here is the scoop: Yes, the room was small...but very adequate and accomdating. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was roomy and the location was great. You are a cab\train\bus\walking distance from anything. We have family that lives in Chicago, so we visit frequently. We booked a last minute trip and choose priceline to get a nice hotel at a reasonable price (and anybody who has been or is trying to go to Chicago, knows rooms downtown can be $$$$). I had read the reviews after booking and was a little hesitant. Don't be. Honestly, the room was very clean and for those who want to spend more time enjoying Chicago...rather than sitting in a room...you will be just fine here. However, if you are looking for accodations like The Ritz...then STAY at the Ritz. You won't find it for less than $100. Save your $$ and use it to buy couture in Chicago...or a great meal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2gogogo
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried after reading some reviews and was pleasantly surprised. Only paid $80 thru Priceline, so perhaps if I had paid twice that much I would have been disappointed. Rooms were small but modern and nicely decorated. Very comfy queen bed - and yes, just one bed, so don't think you'll fit 4 in a room! Check in was quick and painless - professional staff. They couldn't accomodate our request for adjoining rooms, but did have us on the same floor (about 4 doors away from each other.) The hotel was full when we checked in at 6:30pm Saturday and since I hadn't called earlier to make that request I didn't feel like it was unreasonable that they couldn't fill my request. Do have to agree that the wall seemed paper thin when the guests next to us returned to their room pretty late. I felt like I was eavesdropping on their conversation. Luckily they weren't in the mood for an all-night party and things quieted down in short order. We checked out at 10:30 on Sunday but were going to a 2pm matinee of Wicked so they kept our luggage ($1/bag) and had no problem leaving our car there (valet parking of $36 for the night, with no add'l charges for leaving it there until 4pm) while we explored Chicago by taxi and on foot.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot understand the complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: swissisbliss
Reviews.Content: Before I stayed here I read many reviews complaining about small rooms, neighbour noise etc. Although the latter wasn't a problem - maybe I was lucky! I found the rooms to be perfectly large enough for a couple with a separate sleeping area with a very comfy bed, sitting area with couch and huge TV, study area with desk, small kitchenette with sink, microwave and fridge, compact bathroom but what do you want to do in a bathroom except the obvious!! The hotel was very secure needing a card to operate the lift and the decor was ok if a little jaded. The hotel offered room service from their own restaurant or from a few neighbouring ones. also the location was great right in the central loop and a 15 min walk from the Magnificent Mile. Also the price was good compared to other well known establishments. But beware US tax is not included in price quotes and makes a huge difference but this is general!! All in all I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are fine but had temperature Control Problems”
Reviews.Author: deparker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property five other times. Each time, I was fine with the rooms. They are very small but are efficient and clean. They are nicely decorated. Some of the bathrooms are quite large. The location is is a nice Loop location (this is not close to the Mag Mile so be aware of that). Here is the problem I have had every time I have stayed there...I have always had problems with the temperature of the rooms. In summer, the air conditioner never gets the room comfortable enough (no matter how low I set it, the room is always too warm). In winter, the room got so cold and the heater never got the room warm enough (no matter how high I set it). My question? Why have temperature controls in the room if they don't allow you to control the temperature?

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ljwflys
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel 4 hours before check in. They took our bags and we left to go sight seeing. When we got back the bags were already in our room, we could just check in and relax. The hotel is in a great location, we could walk to most of the museums and attractions and the L is very close. I don't mind the size of the rooms and they were clean. My only complaint is with the bathrooms. There was no ventilation fan so it got very damp and didn't seem to dry out. And the shower was only separated from the rest of the bathroom with a curtain. The water ran under the curtain and pooled on the bathroom floor about 1/4 inch deep. If I didn't want to be sloshing around for the rest of the stay I had to mop the floor with a bath towel after each shower. But we got a good deal on Priceline and the location made up for the shower problems.

Reviews.Title: “promises a lot more than they can keep”
Reviews.Author: fewill12
Reviews.Content: The rooms are for Chicago standards dark and very small. Most of them have a view on the brick wall of the next building. The floor I was on as well as my room smelled of smoke, even though I requested non-smoking. The wireless access works only in part of the building and much of the the computer equipment is broken. The staff is very nonchalant about this and had some very interesting explanations for this ("A virus in the wireless router" ???). In summary a place of last resort when everything else in Chicago is booked (they always seem to have rooms open on the weekend) but not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Great Price”
Reviews.Author: schono
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the west loop. 3 minute walk from Quincy station. I stayed four nights in a very cozy room away from the mundane noise. The hotel itself was small, but very comfortable. Although I didnt get the best view of downtown, or quite any view at all, just a window half way tinted, still plenty of light came in. I didnt need the extra commodity of seeing out. Long story short, the hotel staff was friendlty and very helpful. The hotel was packed during my four-night stay, lots of tourist from different countries, not only business men. Various shops are located near the store, (three walgreens in less than a minute walk from the hotel) The hotel is located about 2 minutes walking distance from sears tower, and 30 second walking distance from monroe blue line station. One more block and you'll be in jackson red line station. The only downside to my stay was that downtown dies out after business hour, there is no much to do on this side of the loop after hours. So if like to party and visit the city for fun, for half the price stay here. IT WAS GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome price for the location”
Reviews.Author: Melly_Girl
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline to get the best deal! Yes the rooms are small, but clean, friendly and professional staff, felt safe walking back to the hotel late at night. Parking was a little pricey but it's valet so we didn't have to worry about where to park.

Reviews.Title: “Tight, but PRIME spot”
Reviews.Author: 8m3lia
Reviews.Content: CQ is a great place to stay...very secure, great location, extremely clean, but rather a tight room. If you are the type that likes to hang out in your hotel room, then it may be a tad too small for your lifestyle. However, if you are the type that goes in and out and just see it as a place to rest, change, and sleep...then it will do. The hotel is just a couple blocks from Michigan Avenue, and it's just about a $6 ride to the aquarium/museums. Overall though, I give it two thumbs up. One thing, the service is a tad slow, but not to a point of major frustration.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: leanaann
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend trip and I was very impressed with this hotel. It's in a great location, right in the loop with a ton of places to visit nearby (including the art museum and parks and stuff). The room itself was pretty roomy, but it was a corner room, so that may have been why. The bed was comfy and the room was decorated nicely. We had giant windows that took up 2 of the 4 walls, so that also made the room feel bigger. Everything was clean and the people working there were nice, if not totally friendly. Anyways, I got the room for $79 on hotwire and I feel that it was an excellent value, especially when you consider the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown for the price”
Reviews.Author: FiveOManhattan_KS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Club Quarters in the downtown loop for 7 days and had a really good time. The hotel is clean, quiet, & the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was rather small, but cozy. It's only a few blocks from Union Station, 5 blocks to Michigan Avenue. We found a good, old fashioned style restaurant down the street for breakfeast, which was a 1/2 block east of Clark St on the north side. Can't remember the name though. The parking garage they recommended was good, although they don't allow any in or outs during the day. So we had the car parked the whole time, and only cost $19 per day after the hotel put their stamp on it. So if we go back we'll stay there again, as Chicago is a fun town, with lots of sites to see and good times to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters: Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: missyspencer20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters this May while in Chicago for a conference, and it served my purposes perfectly. The lobby area was new and clean with a lounge area for guest to relax or check the internet. The check-in system was fast, the staff at the front were friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and comfortable. I was pleased with the hotel, especially when considering the affordable rate. I would definitely not dine in the restuarant next time, but would certainly stay at Club Quarters again.

Reviews.Title: “Its okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We werent expecting much from this hotel so we werent disappointed. Others have claimed that the rooms are small but we didnt have a small one at all. It was located in the inside walls so there was no window which gave it a jail kindof feel. The shower gave it a kindof school gym feel. Others complained about the aircondition being turned off and not receiving new towels. There are numerous little notes around the room specifiying that if you want new towels to place your old ones on the floor and to notify the front desk if you want your air to stay on as they turn it off during the day. My main complaint about this hotel was how absolutely humid it was in our room. After a day of walking my husband and I would come back to the hotel and freshen up. I'd wash my face but still feel completely sticky. We bought carmel popcorn which became soggy after keeping it in the hotel room. No matter how low we set the a/c we couldnt get rid of the humidity in the room. My other complaint is that we moved our car into valet the last day so we could have in and out service. When we went to pull it out we were told they couldnt due to a road being closed for the 4th. This was several hours before the fireworks and we even specified when dropping off the car that we were pulling it out of self service so we could use it for dinner. Moving the car to valet was pointless and only ended up costing more. Had we known this before we wouldve bought day CTA passes as we had thought we wouldnt need it since we only road it once that day. It wouldve been cheaper since we had to use it for dinner to get the pass. Overall the hotel was sufficient but nothing really to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottSto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Club Quarters hotel for the Taste of Chicago festival, staying two nights (July 1-2). First off, the location is fantastic. The hotel is located on the corner of Clark and Adams. It is about five blocks from Union Station and four blocks from the Art Institute on Michigan Avenue. If you a fan of coffee, there is a Starbucks on that same corner. But, I seemed to notice that Starbucks were about every two blocks, slightly more prevalent than McDonald's. There were two issues we had. First, we were unable to get an extra pillow. We called the front desk on two consecutive nights. The first night, the receptionist said one would be right up, but it never came. The second night, we were told that there were no extra pillows in the hotel. The second issue was noise. The way the room doors are right next to each other - within inches. Whenever the neighbor would close the door, it sounded like ours was being closed, it was so loud. Walls seemed pretty thin - we could hear conversations pretty easily. With earplugs, it was not much of a problem at night, but it wasn't the quietest place, though street noise was relatively low. Staying at hotels sometimes feels like a coin flip as far as getting people in neighboring rooms that are respectful of others - we just had bad luck. The room itself was small, especially the bathroom, but the bed was comfortable, the room was nicely decorated, the air conditioning worked great, and we had plenty of hot water. The lobby area is small but functional. The attached restaurant, Elephant and Castle, served pretty good French toast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise, great location for business”
Reviews.Author: marksummer
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much but I have to say the Club Quarters Chicago Loop was a nice surprise. If you are working in the loop it is a great location. The rooms are on the smallish side but they are clean and modern. I like the self-check in kiosks and free wireless. Price was decent. Overall, a good choice. Don't bring a car into the loop. Parking is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters Was Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: MrDVMP
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake; Club Quarters is not a swanky downtown luxury hotel. It also does not have the price tag of high-end hotels like The W or Palmer House (both within 2 blocks of C.Q.). If you want to be pampered in a loop hotel, you need to shell out several hundred dollars more a night more then you will at Club Quarters. The folks that are trashing this hotel in their reviews were obviously expecting a 5 star hotel at an unrealistic price. If you choose to stay at Club Quarters what you can/should expect is an extremely clean, amazingly located, remarkably comfortable, safe corporate apartment style hotel. Yes the hallways are small, the amenities basic and the desk staff minimal, but for the money it is a great deal. The rooms are not huge but more then adequate in size. Older NY or London hotel rooms are half the size as these, as are the basic rooms in the Vegas MGM. We estimated that the room was roughly 11â€™ by 30â€™ not including the closet or bathroom. The room was nicely decorated with several modern accents, nice furniture, a comfortable bed and good lighting. The bathroom was clean, brightly lit and larger then we expected based on the reviews we read here. We did hear occasional outside city street noise, but nothing major or disturbing. Extra towels, shampoo, coffee and such are available in a self serve manor from a nearby closets on every floor. Do not expect a fancy view from your window, instead use the amazing location to your advantage and walk the few blocks to the Art Institute or any of the other nearby attractions. The hotel is near three different Loop train stops. Taxis are easy to catch right out the front door. Since Club Quarters is in a quieter part of downtown, if you are looking for nightlife you might need a cab, but there are many nearby bars and restaurants (several that deliver to the hotel). There is also a small fridge and microwave in the room along with the usual stuff you would expect. My wife and I booked our stay on Priceline and got a midweek rate of $150, far less then anything else we found for similar dates on Orbitz, Expedia, Hotels.com â€¦ Remember, this is not a standard hotel it is geared towards the business traveler usually dealing with corporate accounts. We were pleasantly surprised with the room and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, incompetent staff...”
Reviews.Author: tindc
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters location was perfect for our weekend in Chicago- it is a great location, convenient to subway, art institute, millennium park and michigan avenue. The rooms were small but very clean and quiet. However, the staff had problems with simple tasks like charging our credit card. They "accidently" over charged us by 5 times what are nightly rate was and since there was no manager on duty they could not fix the mistake. There is a very good British pub right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay. The hotel is a nice. Very clean rooms, friendly staff and good hospitality. The rooms are small, but are fine for 2 people if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in the hotel. Comfortable beds. Easy acces to CTA transportation buses and trains to get around the loop. We got the rooms for around $90/night. Great value for that price and location. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: histoqueen
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Chicago and really loved the Club Quarters Loop. I see some really negative reviews and I can't understand how people didn't like this hotel unless they are just REALLY hard to please or used to 5 star hotels which this isn't. What it was though was a small, very nicely laid out and appointed hotel with really friendly staff and everything we needed including a gym and a really welcoming lounge with free internet. Most lounges are empty most of the time, but this one was cosy and friendly with people in it most of the day. We had a problem with our toilet - someone came up 15 minutes later to take care of it. We asked for extra blankets and were directed to the self-serve closet down the hall where there were blankets, pillows, irons, and extra supplies for the room. Theh location was excellent - near all of the CTA lines and a number of buses. The lay out is a bit odd with labyrinthine corridors, but the end result is you have only one neighbor so no noise of people coming and going all night. Our room was a suite - definitely a good idea if you have a family because the sofa/bed and kithenette were a plus. Our friend travelling with us had a regular double which was small, but very clean and nice. In short it was a sweet, well situated hotel for a very reasonble price and we would stay there again happily.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed...”
Reviews.Author: curiousfella
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters on West Adams for 8 nights for business, after getting a good deal through Hotel.com. The hotel itself has a compact reception area with a decent lounge next to it with 2 internet access PC's (free of charge), as well as free printing facilities...cool. They have two more internet access PC's on the 3rd floor. The reception and hotel staff in general are friendly and efficient. The rooms themselves are relatively small, by comparison to the usual gargantuan proportions of other US hotels, but any traveller from the UK (or elsewhere in Europe) will find them of normal size. The room was clean and had adequate storage, with a T.V., microwave and fridge as well as a coffee perculator. The bathroom did not have a bath but did have a large walk in shower. The hotel is actually located in the financial district of the city so there isn't much going on in the way of bars and restaurants after 6.00 p.m, but it's only a 10 minute walk north across the river before you hit all of the night life you could want. If you want to locate closer to the action then there is another Club Quarters on Wacker Avenue but I assume this would cost more money. The only downside to the one on West Adams is the so called British pub attached to it, The Elephant and Castle is actually a carbon copy of a British 'theme pub'. The breakfast offered is exorbitantly priced, not very good and the service isn't up to much either. There are plenty of breakfast places within 5 minutes of the hotel so I used those instead. The Americans might think the pub is quaint but I just thought it was 'naff'.

Reviews.Title: “Small but central”
Reviews.Author: IrelandQwerty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference so prices were hiked up, $1000 for 5 days seemed a bit steep. Small foyer small rooms but compact with fridge etc, car parking is pricey and dont be in any hurry to get your car. very central location though off michigan ave for shops etc. It is a beautiful city on the up with great restaurants etc. Staff very friendly and courteous. Best for business or for short stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bubblezz78
Reviews.Content: Definitely excellent! Our experience was not lacking in any way. My husband and I stayed at the end of March for two days. The room was excellent, very roomy, up to date decor, clean, very much up to international standards (I'm American but live in New Zealand). Service was great, atmosphere wonderful, I loved the selection of menus from local restaurants that you can order from and have added to your room tab. I appreciated the mini kitchen, I think that's something sorely lacking in American hotels and motels. We didn't eat at the restaurant on the premises so don't have comment on that. One reviewer had issues with the air conditioning; the info binder in the room did mention that they turn off the heating/air conditioning while you're out for the day, to save energy, but that can be left alone upon request, and our room had its own controls. The price was excellent, especially for what we got. And if you're into downtown Chicago, the location doesn't get better than this. I feel like we got to experience a little bit of authentic Chicago, not just another corporate cookie cutter hotel. Next time I'm in Chicago, I'm definitely going to book this place again. In short, no shortcomings in my opinion and I can be pretty discerning.

Reviews.Title: “Is LOCATION worth the money?”
Reviews.Author: achamma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wacker/Michigan Ave location (there are 2 CQ in Chicago) for a weekend. If you are looking for an "efficiency" room, this is it. It met our basic needs of cleanliness and a comfortable bed. The location was great...easy walking distance to events, fine dining and shopping. We didn't pay a large amount of money on the room so, we'd probably stay there again. Yes, location of hotel is worth the money we spent!

Reviews.Title: “Club Quaters-Perfect for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: lives2shop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple just got back from a weekend at Club Quarters. We booked through Priceline so we weren't sure what we were getting into. There was no need to worry. We found the hotel easily, the doormen helped us promptly, and check in was a breeze. From reading the reviews I knew that the rooms would be small, so that wasn't a shock. But we weren't in Chicago to stay in the room. We found the hotel to be clean, the staff helpful and in a great location. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DasEFX
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters Chicago (Central Loop) was quite chic. It was close to the museams and millennium park, but far from the bars and clubs. The rooms were standard size and had either two twin beds or one queen. My only complant is that they don't provide any blankets, so bring your warm pjs!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: jfrancis11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time, arriving on St. Patrick's Day. Our room was very clean. Very easy to access from the highway and a great location to walk to downtown sites. Food and service at the adjacent pub were fine. We took advantage of the self-park which was $19 a day and only about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The parking structure was very well lit and relatively secure. Just a few steps away from the spot on LaSalle which many will recognize from seeing Brian DePalma's "The Untouchables"!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: RtheDoll
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters is in a great location. The parking was very expensive for the two nights my Dad and I stayed there. We felt safe around the area at night. The Elephant and Castle was a nice pub but the food was a little overpriced for what it was. I was not happy when we requested two beds and only got a queen. I called the front desk and they wanted me to pay 30 dollars more a night for the suite, which would give us a queen bed and a sleeper sofa. Apparently, our check-in at 7pm was too late to get the two-bed room we requested. Our room had the bed and a desk chair and that was it for seating. We didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room so it didn't matter too much anyways, but it was still quite annoying they wanted to charge us more. I found the climate control to be either too hot or too cold and our room smelled of cigarettes. Overall, it was okay, you get what you pay for, and if you have the need for two beds, check-in early.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the quarters”
Reviews.Author: aks001
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters in the Loop was just fine for a single traveler. I paid $ 75 thru priceline. clean and convenient to the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent Friday and Saturday night at CQ Chicago and it was great. Terrific location and wonderful service from a very helpful staff. Valet parking is only $33 and they are prompt to retrieve your car. As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms are quite small but clean and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: elenabeau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at CQ last February. The room was very clean though small. Do not expect Ritz-Carlton type service- CQ is very laid back. We loved the location-very close to Mag mile, CI of Art and many nice restaurants. We had a nice view of Chicago. The doormen helped to get a cab at any time. We'd go back to CQ if they keep their prices reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BuddyHolly59
Reviews.Content: This is not a family oriented hotel. Unless you are going to book a separate room for your kids, go elsewhere if that is what you are looking for. Simply put the rooms are small and that is because the hotel is designed for business travelers: not families with small kids. My wife and I stayed at the Club Quarters Hotel, Wacker Drive, the weekend of 10-1-05. We were drawn to it because of the price (125.00 nite) and its location, which is spectacular. The hotel overlooks the Chicago River and is at the intersection of Wacker and Michigan Ave. It is within easy walking distance of Water Tower Place, The Art Institute, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, and State Street. As noted, our room was small. It included one double bed, one small window, one small desk, one desk chair and a small bath. Storage for our luggage was barely adequate. The bathroom came with a nice shower but no tub. The hotel lobby was pretty with a art deco staircase and a comfortable waiting area sporting a TV and complimentary newspapers to read. There is an unpretentious and very enjoyable cafe/bar off the hotel lobby called the Bella Bucino. The food at Bella Bucino was very good ($21.00 for a small pizza for two and a couple of iced teas) and was friendly and laid back. Breakfast is served and is reasonable for the area. Ditto for the excellent martinis' that the bar serves. We really enjoyed the al fresco dining. The views from the outdoor tables are spectacular. In the evening the bar had a jazz combo performing and if the Ron Bailey Trio is there when you stay, make sure you catch them. They are the real deal. Better yet, there was no cover charge. We found parking with free in and out privilages directly adjacent to the hotel on the east side for $25.00 a night. The staff of the hotel were extremely accomodating. Our room was cleaned promptly. Carpet, walls and bath fixtures were in tip top condition. The restaurant and bar staff were also gracious. They made sure that our meal came out quickly so that we could make our evening theater on time and they offered dead on suggestions for dining in the area. All in all a great value for what you get as long as you understand that if you want to stay in your room and watch TV mtd. on a wall, you are either going to do it while laying on your bed or sitting in a desk chair.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I last stayed in this hotel four years ago and was afraid I'd find it in worse shape. I'm pleased to report that this was not the case. The owners seem to have done a good job maintaining it. For the price, it's hard to beat this hotel. I stayed during a September weekend, when it seemed every other decent hotel was sold out. All of the hotels in CQ's price range made me nervous (read the reviews of them on this website.) So I was glad to have a dependable place to stay. One reviewer said the area was deserted at night and on weekends, but I didn't find this to be the case at all. The Loop now has many good hotels, and the theater and retail scene is very lively. If you want to visit the Art Institute, Millennium Park, shop at Marshall Fields, or see a show at the Goodman Theater, this place is very well located. It's also convenient to Midway Airport (home of Southwest Airlines) because you can take the Orange Line to Wabash/Adams, three blocks away. However, if you want to spend all your time around the Gold Coast, Lincoln Park, and the northern reaches of Michigan Ave., you're better off staying in a hotel further north. My room was small (when the closet door was open, you couldn't get into the bathroom!), but it was adequate for a single traveler. The greater issue for me was the noise. This is not a well soundproofed hotel, and it was made worse by inconsiderate guests who came in late and shouted to one another down the hallways. I used earplugs my second night there, and that solved the problem. Look, if price were no object, I'd stay at the Peninsula. But since it is, I'm glad that something like CQ is within my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, Self Service hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago with a friend of mine for a shopping weekend. Since there was a big convention in town, options were slim but hotwire offered the best price. We needed a room with 2 beds - which the hotel website indicates are limited. Reading other reviews on the '2 bed rooms' I was a little nervous. Called the morning of arrival and had no problem aquiring one. Staff at the desk were very courteous. The room and the beds were just fine - I'm 5'9, HWP and had no trouble with the size of either (my friend is tall as well). Love the English Pub. I would rate it above average except for one thing. This is a "self service" hotel and it showed - if you need an iron, you need to go get it in the "guest service closet" down the hall. After the 1st nights stay, our room was not totally cleaned, I'm guessing because we left 1 towel on the rack (indicating "I'll use it again"). The beds were made and new soap was delivered, but the coffee machine and mugs weren't cleaned, no new pack of coffee, and all the towels were strewn about as we had left them. It's as if they left half way through the job. On day 2, we put everything on the floor including the coffee pot and things got done! :) If it wasn't for that, I'd give this place a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Classy - Met expectations...”
Reviews.Author: luvchitown
Reviews.Content: CQ was just as I suspected after reading the reviews. The hotel lobby is simple and classy and very cozy. There are plenty of soft couches, chairs, and a large TV just for lounging around. Also - 2 computers to use whenever you wish....good computers. Fast. Our room was on the 3rd floor, was comfortable, and not nearly as small as some reviewers stated. In fact, it was a "Queen" but was much larger than your standard Queen. The box spring was simply two twins put together, but the mattress on top was decently firm (but not too firm) and the pillows and comforter were nice. The decor was decent - nice dark cherry wood desk with fridge and clean and nice microwave. Although the TV was smaller than most hotel rooms, we didn't care as we weren't planning on spending much time in the room. The bathroom was fine and I actually did prefer the non-tub shower which was bigger than your typical stand-up. It was very clean and nicely kept. Only two beefs with the room.....1 - the towels are sub-par at best and 2 - the air conditioner was very loud and didn't seem to condition or cool the air as much as we would have liked. But - we were comfortable enough not to complain. The restaurant is very nice - the breakfast is decent too. The hotel is located close to EVERYTHING, including very easy access to the "L." Here's the deal on the parking: Valet is 33 bucks a night, but just down the street you can park overnight at a lower rate. The thing that CQ doesn't tell you though is that you need to get your parking ticket validated to get the lower rate. Would have been nice to know! Great experience overall at a very low rate (70/night)!

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced hotel with better alternatives just around the corner”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to attend a nearby conference -- it was the official recommended conference hotel and we booked on this basis, opting for a room upgrade to a suite at $150 per night. The experience has been terrible -- I am writing this review on the second to last night after yet another example of CQ's terrible attitude to customer service. Tonight, having returned at 10pm from a wonderful but long day out we dropped into the hotel restaurant to enquire about late food. We were told that service was available until 11pm and on that basis went up to our room for a quick change, returning to the restaurant at 10.30, in plenty of time, or so we thought, for our food. To our dismay we were then told that there would be no food service and in fact that the bar/restaurant was closing early tonight. We were told by restaurant staff that the kitchen sometimes closed early if business was slow. When we complained to the hotel manager a few minutes later we got the most convoluted story as an excuse for closure -- clogged "grease traps" rendering the kitchen a fire hazard, despite the fact that diners continued to dine behind closed doors. I must say that this interaction with the duty manager was most unsatisfactory.
