He was rude and unhelpful and never attempted to apologise for the problem, let alone own up to the truth behind the closer. I write all of this as an example of the sort of rude and unhelpful staff behaviour that we have witnessed on more than one occassion during the course of the past week. In terms of the room we have -- our upgrade buys us a small dark room with a leaky air conditioning system (which we complained about to no avail) a blocked lavatory and minimal in-room services; for example, we continue to receive a single tea bag each day for our tea and coffee facilities. In my experience this hotel is over-priced and under-performing. The staff need much better basic training, for sure. I wouldn't come again and certainly would not recommend it to others. Try the Crown Plaza, which is just up the street and by all accounts a much better option all around.

Reviews.Title: “Small? Not to us.”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynLodgers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Club Quarters, Central Loop, in August 2005, and were concerned about the tiny size of the rooms as reported in Trip Advisor. In fact, we planned to stay one night in the smallest, cheapest room and then move for the rest of our stay (the 3 weekend nights) in a more expensive larger room. But we found the original room perfectly adequate, and cancelled the move to a bigger room. I paced off the space between the bed and the door - about 7 feet by 11 feet, which was all we needed for using the desk, the drawers, the TV. We didn't bring a cat with us so we can't say whether there would have been room to swing one. On the subjective side, the simple wood decor was a relief after staying a few nights in chintz-draped B&Bs. On the practical side we liked the feature of being able to get an extra blanket or some decaf for the coffeemaker from the closet on our floor, rather than calling the front desk for them. The three PCs with internet access and free printing were a real help, as was the coin laundry room. The pub on the first floor had good, reasonably-priced food, and we found it convenient to put the restaurant tab on our hotel account. So we would recommend this hotel highly to anyone looking for a comfortable place to stay in the center of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected city delight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you have a chance to stay in the hotel, it's a great value. It offers great amenities and is very conveniently located. Some websites might not post the best pictures, but it seems as though in the recent past, the entire hotel has been remodeled-even the hallways are nice. They have two computers in the main floor guest lounge which are great for printing boarding passes, finding attractions/directions, etc. It's comfortable and the service was prompt and curtious. You could even have exercise equipment delivered to your room if you didn't want to work out in their fitness center. The only negative thing I could mention about the stay was that the water pressure in the shower wasn't that great. But otherwise, this is a fantastic place to stay, and I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Cleanliness, Location and Ammenities!”
Reviews.Author: mhamerlind
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this property over the weekend (Aug 19-21) after booking through priceline.com for under $100/night. While we had our reservation on how good the hotel would be for <$100 in the heart of downtown, we took our chances. Upon arrival and check-in, we were THRILLED with the location, upscale decor, amenities and spotless room! The front desk staff was great as he was more than happy to check our bags until our room was ready so we could go out into the city for the afternoon. The room itself was cozy and small but more than adequate in size for two people. The two twin beds were luxuriously comfortable with superior mattresses; quality, high-thread count sheet and beautiful, heavy comforters, topped of with thick pillows. The cherry wood desk and work area were top quality while the room even featured a standard microwave and mini-fridge. The bathroom was spotless, featuring wonderful soaps, complimentary mouthwash, glass cocktail glasses and a coffee/tea maker. Other amenities that went above-and-beyond our expectations were a shopping service to stock the mini-fridge at REGULAR consumer prices (vs. inflated room service prices), delivery of treadmills or exercise bikes TO YOUR ROOM for working out in private, free WiFi service throughout the property and free PC's and printers to use in the club room on the main level. We'd stay at Club Quarters for future trips to Chicago without question! The downtown location is suberb- 1 block from the Blue Line Jackson stop and 2 blocks from the State Street Red Line stops. You're 6 blocks from the Art Institute and in the heart of the city! OUTSTANDING!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied Club Quarters Chicago- Central Loop”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, staff was great, room was clean and a very quiet location. Restaurant staff was excellent and so was the food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: newbeeSTL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were doing the tourist thing in Chicago for 3 nights July 24th - 27th. Booked this hotel and it couldn't have turned out much better. Excellent central location downtown. Yeah, if you're going to Chicago to spend a bunch of time in your hotel room, it's going to be small. Plenty of room for the usual hotel stuff, ie sleeping and getting ready to leave. They have computers available for your use for the internet and printing which is an extra bonus. Very fast connection too. The room was clean and well kept, everything was in order. Overall an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff didn't deliver”
Reviews.Author: tlwintc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from Priceline, which was a first for us. We were looking for 3 rooms to accomodate 8 women and having a difficult time, so we offered $100. per night offer and Priceline assigned us to Club Quarters. We were shocked and amazed, but happy! We were celebrating 2 "monumental birthdays" in our group and were told that the 2 rooms w/birthdays would receive a suite and the other room would receive a bottle of wine. (I was in the "other room" and celebrating a birthday, but would only have 1 other person staying w/me; so passed my upgrade to the others in our party.) We took all of our luggage up to our room because it was ready and the other rooms would not be ready until later in the afternoon. (No bell person was available to take care of our luggagge which was kind of surprising!) I was shocked when I opened our door to see the size of the room! We were not planning on spending a lot of time in the room, but being able to move about was close to impossible in this room. It was the teeniest room I have ever seen. I realize this hotel caters to the "business world", Monday through Friday; but I travel for business and have never seen anything quite so small. Before leaving the hotel, I stopped by the front desk and spoke to Angelo Garcia, who had been so great at helping us earlier, and asked him if there was someway to upgrade my room & I would pay whatever the price was for room change. He advised me to check back when the others got their rooms and he would see what he could do and says he will not charge for the upgrade if he can get an upgrade. I asked for his business card because I believe in letting employers know when someone goes out of their way to make something pleasant for someone else. Cut to the chase, arrive back to the hotel to clean up before we leave for our show and find out that all 3 rooms are the teeny rooms and that Angelo has left for the day and has the next day off. We were told the teeny rooms could not accomodate a roll away, so we are screwed. 3 women in a full size bed is not the way any of us wanted to spend our weekend getaway. They ended up relenting and gave the rooms w/3 people a roll away, but it definitely put a dent in the "fun time" we had planned for our Chicago get away w/no spouses or children. Turns out the hotel was oversold for the night. We met in the lobby (no possiblity of meeting in one of our rooms because of the size) before catching cabs and overheard someone who had booked 2 rooms on Priceline get a refund for 1 room they weren't going to be using that evening. Overselling rooms is common, I realize. Promising people something you have no intention of being able to deliver is just wrong. We went on and had a great weekend despite the rooms. Hotel 71 (which is where we had stayed on our last visit) was hosting NSync's Children's Charity event and we gawked at all of the Stars coming and going! Also, the Corner Bakery, was perfect for all of our breakfast needs, very yummy way to start out the day. Bottom line is sometimes you do get what you pay for! Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in both June and July while visiting Chicago. It's a very nice place to stay, and is ideally located between Union Station and Michigan Avenue. Moreover, they have a "Night on the House" program which allows for a free night at any Club Quarters after 2 different stays. Our room -- we somehow ended up with the exact same room both stays -- was a little small, but it met all of our needs. Moreover, reference books, a fridge, and a microwave are included in the room, plus low-cost snacks and beverages can be delivered to you. The soap and shampoo were of good quality, but the mouthwash didn't taste all that great. The shower had a detachable shower head with long cord, so you can get a thorough wash. An office building was right across the street, so the view wasn't all that great, though other parts of the hotel may have better viewpoints. We will happily stay at the Club Quarters during future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Room”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a difficult time booking a hotel in Chicago. Most of the hotels were sold out or we could have paid $300-400 per night. We finally found the Club Quarters Hotel and the price was excellent. Also the hotel was in the area of dowtown Chicago that we wanted to stay; close to Michigan Ave, Grant Park, restaurants, shops, etc. We weren't expecting all that much from the hotel because we knew we were getting a good price for a room. Much to our surprise our room was a mini-suite. Not that we spent a lot of time in our room because we were visiting with friends and exploring the city, but it was wonderful to return to a cozy comfortable room. We definitely will stay at the Club Quarters Hotel the next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: cmw611
Reviews.Content: I haved stayed at this hotel more times then I can count. My hotel of choice is usually the Chicago Hilton and Towers but I cannot afford that much anymore! Yes the rooms are sometimes small, but they have always been clean and well appointed. I like the location..close to everything practically! I like the security of having to use your room key to get in certain parts of the hotel. The resturant is not bad at all..decent price. I have actually stayed there more for pleasure then business! I will most certainly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery, given other negative reviews. However, I enjoyed my stay at Club Quarters and would choose them again. We loved the convenience to el stops, bus stops, Grant Park, State Street. The room was small, but comfortable. We requested a quiet, off-street side room and received it. We were close to many of our favorite haunts- Trattoria no. 10 on Dearborn & Washington, Atwood Cafe on State & Washington, Corner Bakery on Michigan & Jackson for a lighter meal, Garrett's Popcorn for the classic Chicago snack on State & Jackson. My only complaints would be that the front desk staff was not knowledgeable about what I consider a tourist "must"- the Chicago Transit Authority multi-day pass. We forgot to order ours online prior to travel & they didn't know where to direct us to buy one. I used to live in downtown Chicago but couldn't readily recall a currency exchange close to the hotel. The front desk proceeded to direct me to an American Express currency exchange but I didn't take that advice. You can buy the multi-day passes at 27 E. Adams- a 2 day pass is $9.00, but they have a whole range. The other minor complaint is the sheet quality- scratchy & definitely not what you'd get in higher-priced hotel, but you get what you pay for. Overall, the place is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Beds and Room too small!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on priceline. We realize that we cannot be guaranteed a bed type. Priceline states all rooms will accommodate two adults...(King, Queen, 2 doubles etc.) Well, what you get is Queen and etc. Etc equals twin beds - that is it. This hotel does not have doubles or Kings we were told. This is fine if you are small. My husband is 6'6" and I am 5'9". Since our experience is that neither of us have enough room in a queen size bed, we decided to go with the twin. When we get to the room we find VERY SMALL TWIN BEDS. We were there three nights and didn't get much sleep. Beds not long enough or wide enough! These were the smallest twin size beds I've ever seen! We felt as though we were in a ship, as it was an extremely "tight", compact small room.

HotelInfo.Name: Club Quarters Chicago - Central Loop
HotelInfo.Address: 111 W Adams St, Chicago, IL 60603
